fRNOT-lTuGwc_h5KDduNIA.text: This has to been the nicest classiest place I've been to in a long time it is a beautiful restaurant and the food is delicious compliments to the chef wow.  the prices are reasonable based on what you ordering of course this is an upscale place so you're going to pay a little more for the cost of the food but it is worth it the atmosphere is great.

eY03ogXcBGX2C3GHLoZjfg.text: Bartender Steven was pretty rude.  Heather was better.  But service is pretty spotty.  The ceviche was great, and for $9 is one of the better values.  The huge side of roasted beets for $5 was also great.  The carrots - not so much...bland, etc.  Only 1 bathroom downtstairs.  Bathrooms upstairs are bigger and pretty cool.  Both upstairs & downstairs bars are cool, more intimate downstairs.  The menu is really pretty pricey.  Same menu as Richardson's/Dick's Hideaway, and they serve both menus at Rokerij, which a lot of people don't realize.

GBtPcYbd-RoBrKr0NDFr3w.text: Love the basement bar. Nice atmosphere, bartenders know how to make decent cocktails and the Chile Relleno was gringofied, but tasty. Had some meat thing the bartender recommended- it was ok, but no love from me.  I definitely recommend this place for a nice evening out.

z2xa5tyhKn4VDsTxz4C1nA.text: Amazing food!!!!!! One of the best meals I've had in a long time!!! Super cool and chill environment, we will definitely be back!

tFLdfrEreX1pYV_nFg-0Hw.text: Downstairs bar is very intimate and cozy!! Not to mention friendly, the staff there is anything but shy. Dave recommended his faves on the menu and  took us on a tour of the whole rest of he restaurant after we were done with dinner. The pasta Heidi is a must have if you're a first timer!!

aogIMsOOAqE6Ux2p4XEVaQ.text: One of my favorites. Sit at the bar or wherever, its always great. I love Pasta Heidi!

8HnxZ1uQWKBIEMW4wvr3Eg.text: I've heard about this place for years and finally made my way down the stairs!  We were deciding to go out, somewhere between Arcadia and Union Hills.  Many names came to mind like Richardson's ( so sad to hear of the fire!) , Dick's Hideaway, Bomberos, but we decided on the Rokerij.    The staff is friendly, attentive and on it!  There are only 3 tables for dining downstairs and there was a wait, which is fine.  We noshed on the stuffed  mushrooms and bacon wrapped shrimp while lounging on the sofa near the fireplace.  They had ESPN on and the Tour recaps were looping, music playing at a nice level and it wasn't crowded at all.  We had a New Zealand Sauvignon Blanc, perfect with the apps.  Great experience overall - I will return!

VtYp5m805e58Esu-TqEzpw.text: My Sis and I had a brunch day and we were going to check out Dick's Hideaway, but we decided that seating might be better here at Rokerij.  We were seated right away, at 11 on Sunday so I was happy it wasn't too crowded.  I love the look of this place, the dark room with a fireplace is awesome.  I loved the coffee to start.  My Sis had the meatloaf with eggs, I had the rellenos with eggs (one beef one cheese) and we ordered Carne Adovado to take home to her Hubby.  We REALLY ENJOYED our meals.  My beef relleno was so amazing and the cheese was just as good.  I loved the smokey flavor, especially the carne adovado.  Our waiter was amazing, great recommendations and clearly happy to be there.

0LZlxLKPYXf51h53kdR8sA.text: Ohhh Rokerij, how I love you so!  To begin, I do not think I have ever encountered an unfriendly or rude server here. The staff, both upstairs and downstairs, is incredibly friendly and helpful.  The wine list is amazzzzzing. So many yummy wines to choose from! Start with a glass of wine, then choose a couple of appetizers like the Brie Toasts or the stuffed mushrooms. Then, as a main course, go with the Garlic Plate or the Gumbo. Sooo good. Or the Porterhouse, or the Sea Bass, or the Pasta Heidi.. Can't go wrong with any of those. Even their House Salad is amazing.   After dinner, enjoy some berries and gelato. Not too fattening but absolutely delicious!

qYIYztYCFeaBMBnGildEdA.text: Can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet. I love this spot! The food is great, the dining vibe is perfect (think cozy wine cellar) and all the staff are friendly. I mostly have visited for lunch, so prices are decent. Not sure how the dinner prices compare.   Tip: Stay away from he fresh bread... It is sinfully delicious, and you will not have willpower to leave room in your stomach for entrees (and they are worth it!)

Tx-ivZAQFFAbXpc7e5CDqg.text: I'm very generous in this 3 star review.  This has been my absolute go to restaurant for 4 years. I was obsessed with their wine, service, bread, green chile potatoes, red meat (when I still ate it) and their fish specials. Every time we've had special guests in town, we've taken them here. Due to having a child , getting healthier and busier, it's been months since our visit. It was hot, sweaty, and we totally ignored.  After ordering entrees and  several bottles, we saw our food eons later.  There was no bread as well. And the more I thought about it, our old waiter was much better, yet he NEVER remembered us. Even though we came in regularly (weekly) and were very generous. So mabeye I shouldn't be surprised. I guess I wanted to like this place more than it deserved :(

irVPqQV9GepjdUVcPSxYBg.text: Amazing food and good service.  Lots of variety. Nice portions but the actual space inside the restaurant is too small and dark. Parking is only valet and always pretty busy. Make reservations if you choose to come here.

mqaBKuUUvpBotoTxKr-uQw.text: 3 1/2 stars (but I'll round up).  It's good, but not particularly outstanding. I love New Mexican (as in the state) food and understand the addition of broader American and Mexican options in the menu... but found myself wishing they had stuck with a single theme, and done it well.  The sauces (for enchilada, chile relleno) were wonderfully flavored.  I was not impressed with the ceviche (probably because I was not anticipating a tomato based marinade).  Wine list was good.    It's an accessible menu.  I think I was hoping for more niche-cuisine.

LkwLhvi2GxIlK6ribEjVDw.text: This place is SERIOUSLY amazing. The atmosphere, decor, and semi-secret bar present a wonderful dining experience. Our server Jamie was attentive, thoughtful, and helped us choose amazing pairings for our food. The food...oh my goodness, I am such a foodie, and this totally hit home! I will come back here ANY TIME.

iZsD1AyzECtbWN9BVVoM2w.text: Great potential but every time there is poor service, over priced food, and poor customer service... Example...No splitting bills despite a large bill to them.... We have tried it too much and will now have to say good bye to them.

WexOzqTE4Y2M1kmM0cyJ1w.text: My fiance took his pediatric boards yesterday and that calls for a no-more-studying-at-coffee-shops-during-dinner celebration! We are brand new to Phoenix and these last few months have been eating lots of Mexican and some more Mexican, which we are not complaining about in the least, but it was time for something different. Our neighbor recommended Richardson's/Rokerij as his favorite so I made a reservation for Monday night.  We sat in their downstairs dining room tucked in a generous booth in the back corner. My fiance ordered a Dark and Stormy and we split a bottle of Pinot Noir as our server informed us of their 1/2 price bottles of wine deal. Hurrah! We ordered 2 appetizers: the bacon-wrapped scallops and the crab-stuffed mushrooms. One bite of the scallops and we were in heaven. They were GIANT, perfectly cooked, and beautifully placed in a pool of amazingly different dipping sauces. You can never go wrong with wrapping bacon on a piece of, well, anything, but this appetizer was magical.  My fiance ordered the Rokerij Steak with roasted corn and mashed sweet potatoes in a chili pepper. I'm not a steak lover, but took one bite of his dish and it melted in my mouth. Fantastic. I ordered the Swordfish special with roasted eggplant and mashed sweet potatoes in the chili pepper as well, and I devoured every bite!   What did it for me, however, was the dessert. We shared the truffle with vanilla gelato topped with berries. The truffles were like buttery brownies in a hard shell and perfectly portioned to satisfy. Very memorable. We will be back, even if it's just for the truffles!

ghu5Z9ai6lnaXH873_Ay0A.text: Pecan trout, green chile potato, and broccolini very good. Carne adovada good

6sUxeln2fd_QEhaTuDB94g.text: Love this place. Food and ambiance is amazing. Do it! They have a decent happy hour too

fLAbnoxnfAlMRf5eQBha8w.text: Heard about this place from one of my son's friends. Looked it up and fell in love with the idea of a fireplace and low lighting. So one weekday my girl and I met up for happy hour here and we both fell in love with the ambiance as soon as we entered. We came in the wrong door downstairs, and were a little confused as to where to go lol bar in the basement was full so we were directed up the staircase. The bar there was also full but lucky for us a couple decided to head down to the basement and free'd up the seats for us :) (bet they thought we came up from down there and emptied our seats at that bar .. suckers) .  We sat down and it took a little while before we were helped, but the way we talk it didn't matter. We each ordered our drinks, prickly pear margaritas, which were absolutely delicious. Made with fresh squeezed lemon. We decided to order a few appetizers. Chile Relleno made with pork (even though I wanted duck), Ceviche and the  Beef Tenderloin toasts.  The chile relleno and toasts were to die for! The pork inside the relleno was smoky and tender and flavorful. So darn good! As were the toasts. I could have eaten two orders all by myself. The meat was so tender and tore apart with the toast without tugging. The cheese was creamy and just the right amount topping off a buttery toast. YUM!!  The ceviche was good, but nothing out of the ordinary. I will for sure order the toasts again and try the garlic plate. A couple next to us ordered it and it looked delicious.   The staff and chef there were very nice and took great care of us! I canNOT wait to go back. I have been craving it since I left.  Definitely need to make a dinner date out of it too as the eggs benedict looked so darn good! I want to try one of everything!.   LOVE YOU ROKERIJ!!!

TGLU0HjzuaKwytF8_DZbjw.text: I have been a regular here with my husband for a long time and it never let's me down. The only down side is the price of food. Honestly I'd be still willing to pay because I love this place so much. We always get the filet and some sort of fish. You also can't go wrong with the roasted corn and sweet potato baked in the beautifully presented green chili. Love the beer and wine selection aswell.

mjzdcs2BpVTGf1Ncshnr2g.text: This place rocks! A dark, ambivience atmosphere- perfect for a romantic dinner or a group of friends. I reserved  a table for a party of 8  for New Years Eve dinner. And they were very accommodating for us. They offer a good selection of seafood, steak and  if you are looking for smaller, try the small plates. You can get one, two or even three for a reasonable price. I had seared ah-tuna and mushroom-brie mini bruschetta toasts for my small plates and they were perfect! They also have great salads. They place is usually crowded and especially on a holiday evening even more so and noisy so if you are looking for quietness, not here! But if you are like me and enjoy the patrons as a part of the dining establishment, shouldn`t bother you! I get a kick out of people watching as well. I`m waiting for Richardson`s to come back but in the meantime will be back here for more!

yPiQkKL38pofD_qjtpckdQ.text: WOW!!!!!!!! I am FURIOUS with myself that I have just NOW made it here. To call Rokerij a hidden gem is an understatement. One of the coolest places I've been in my life. It is cozy, intimate and sexy. You're at the top of your game if you bring a date here-you will wow them and they'll think you're the bomb (if they haven't been here). It's also a great place to just chill with a small group of friends.  You nostrils will be tempted with the smell of a cozy fire and mouthwatering dishes before you even get throught the door. The upstairs dining room surrounds an open kitchen. Low lighting and a roraring fire-HELLO...need I say more? I highly recommend the downstairs cellar which has a long copper-top bar, along with a few tables-there is also a little cozyy nook/booth-PERFECT place to get a little romance on. The food is outstanding-I highly recommend the 3-plate/$25 offering. The portions are generous-plenty for two people to share. The bartenders downstairs are AWESOME and are always ready to make an enthusiastic recommendation if you can't decide. The music played downstairs is awesome too. EVERYTHING about this place is a awesome. My first night here was nothing short of PERFECT!!!!

ibxpcaRhTHcDpI-ByQFA-A.text: Downstairs bar is an absolute favorite.  Great small plates and even better service.  I love their stemware. :)

59MBQC92AQRcenc7UABp9g.text: I loved this place. My husband and I met another couple for dinner at Rokerij on Saturday night. From 4-6 pm, the small plates are $5 each. It is such a great deal. The catch: you have to be sitting at the bar. Not in the booths next to the bar, but at the bar. Each couple ordered 4 small plates and then we all shared. Pretty much everything I tasted, I liked. The brie toasts were by far my favorite...I could have ate the whole plate myself.  The bacon wrapped scallops were really good as well; the calamari was delicious especially because the breading wasn't very heavy and it was quite tasty as well (we consider ourselves calamari snobs). The crab tostadas were good but I don't enjoy cold crabmeat too much.  My husband tried the shrimp scampi and he liked it, but said that if hadn't come with the rice, it would have been bland. He said the rice added flavor to the dish.  With the small plates, it seems that most of the plates come with six of that particular item.   Drink prices were really good...for 8 small plates and 9-10 drinks between the four of us, our bill came to $84. I was shocked when the bill came because it was so cheap, considering all we ate and drank.  The decor in the downstairs bar area is really cool...it's very dim and dark, but it is really cozy. There was a real fire in the fireplace which gave it a log cabin type of feel.  I will definitely be back.

KtuDoY-OQMvKmhF1i5mjwQ.text: Went there for sunday breakfast, deeply disappointed!!  we wanted to sit at the bar, but the chairs (which have no backs) were so squeezed together, you could not help but hit elbows with the person on both sides of you.  The hostess offered no relief, even tho there were empty stools that could have been removed.   I ordered scrambled eggs with ham and toast.  what I got was a boring, flat "plain" omelet, some kind of plain dry dark bread (it's the only kind they offer)  oh, also, there are no straws for your drinks, they just don't ever have any.  All the servers are in a lousy mood,  I was not offered a refill on my iced tea, which cost $3, where most other places charge $2.  my advice -- stay away from this place!!

U0I9PrpuwfcXvF6V1KwWRQ.text: Ditto to everyone else's comments thus far.  We dropped in for a drink the other night and were very pleasantly surprised with how hidden and cool the underground bar was. They also have Chimay on tap??? That's hard to mess with.   We had already eaten a big dinner so we didn't go there but even a cursory glance at the menu left me inspired to come back soon. And I'm sure their cuisine won't fall far from the Richardson's tree, which is a very good thing, in my book.

13PeQikj5yaurNJYnWwN5Q.text: I really enjoyed myself here.  The atmosphere is really cool.  My girlfriend says the smell of the burning fireplace reminded her of Aspen... you could smell the wood burning when you pulled into the parking lot.  The service was excellent and the food was also very good.  We ate downstairs at the bar and chose a few things off the small plates section of the menu.  They also had a lot of fresh fish choices on the specials board.  I would definitely come back here again.

4UBly2FW6kFqgAXp9RpX4w.text: Excellent food here.  It's nice to be able to get your chile fix without having to take a trip to New Mexico.  I had their Carne Adovada and Eggs for brunch, which was fabulous.  The pork is first smoked before they simmer it in red chile until it is tender to the point where you barely even need to chew it.   Only complaint with the joint would be that they keep it a little on the dark side.  I felt like I was squinting to see everything despite the fact that it was in the middle of the day.

kf7zfVLINMjhoyH__6v9tA.text: My friend and great dinner companion visited Rokerij and was I in for an unexpected wonderful night of food.  I heard about this place but never really believed the food was this delicious.  We ordered  and shared best of two worlds: the porterhouse steak with mashed potatoes and roasted eggplant and the swordfish with the green chile sweet potato and broccolini.  With Sunday night's half off bottle of wine, this is a great Sunday dinner place.  Rokerij, you will forever be in my heart as one of the best dinner restaurants in central phoenix.

UCej98at5-gNlM0LHQtXXQ.text: This is a friendly bustling neighborhood-type place which I love.  The three stars only are for having fish on the menu that isn't up to the standards of their beef dishes and apps. Sea bass smothered in a sweet and sour sauce with chiles, not very fresh and overcooked --uggh.  However, I did croon over my neighbor's beef dish. The crab mini-tosadas are really good. And the vegetable side dishes-all of them, including brocolini, brussel sprouts, potato in a pot, and asparagus--are commendable.  Great atmosphere!! Have fun.

RTZwd9kZ9nyzeiN7wv3Oww.text: Ok I love this place!!!! Pick a rainy night when nothing sounds better then cozy-ing up to the fire, listening to great tunes and sipping a fabulous blueberry lemon drop or sophisticated glass of wine and there is no better place to be in Phoenix.  So unique from the big flashy restaurants smattered up and down Scottsdale.  You can dine upstairs, or downstairs at the bar in a bit more casual environment.  I have to admit that I have yet to eat upstairs.  Downstairs, you can get the same menu + and easily fill up on very substantial light fare at a reasonable price.  Try the beef tenderloin toasts and you will come back again and again.  Everyone is so friendly here, from bartenders to patrons.  If only there were more places in phoenix like this! Our own little piece of Aspen - go, go, go.

Nb4p7PDzY-YtN6SOAaOBCg.text: I had heard really good things about this place and had high hopes. I wanted to like it so badly but no dice. We were starving and conveyed this to our server who kept saying "take your timeeeee, no rush." Ha, no really. We would have loved it rushed. We were HUNGRY! We decided to try the quesadilla du jour after our server told us it was shredded pork in their special sauce. Instead, he brought us the oyster du jour. He said he thought we ordered the oysters. My boyfriend hates seafood and we had just had a lengthy discussion with the server regarding what the quesadilla of the day was. Huh, how did he get that wrong?! He kept running away as we were trying to give him our dinner order. It was just such a long process! My boyfriend ordered the sirloin steak medium rare and I ordered the green chili burger. His steak tasted like hamburger meat and my fries were cold. My burger was good though and I did enjoy the ambiance of sitting near the fireplace in a cozy booth, so thumbs up for that! We waited for our check. And waited. And waited. We put our credit card ON the table near the edge. And waited. Finally, our server brought it over. Our meal took over 2 hours for the two of us. I was falling asleep near the end as we tried to get the check. Between the service and the food, I don't think I'll give this place another shot.

Qkqe2QtKYRL-IN_WzPcyOQ.text: A favorite for dinner.  Scores with the trifecta of great food, good service, and killer ambiance.  Dark and romantic.  Really good moody alternative music playing in the background.  Comfy booths that make you want to linger over dinner for hours.  I guess the story is that it is supposed to resemble the smokehouses of the Netherlands?  I can't comment about that because I have never been to the Netherlands, but I love the vibe here.   Upscale.  American/New American food.  Meat intensive, so don't bring your vegetarian date here.  Don't over-order, the portions are quite big.  That's it.  Go.

X4NGzybd01CPL_jzvvzlTQ.text: Love every meal we've had here! Small plates are awesome, half price wine is awesome, GCP.... AWESOME!  Can't go wrong with pretty much anything on the menu, meals are hearty

_CjCv9C50bVERYhfZtLoYw.text: The food is great, the bar very cool. I enjoy the atmosphere, but not the bartenders. I understand people can have a bad day, but I get the sense it's not just a bad day, I think they are just rude. Still, I give it 3 stars for good food, good clientele, nicely designed bar. It would be great if the staff didn't think they were so much cooler then the customers. Hire nice or just simply not rude people and I will give it 5 stars. By the way, the bus staff seemed very friendly and polite.

ufXG_O1mkXK9KdyeEad-AA.text: So the funny thing about good restaurants is that you almost don't want to tell anyone about them and make it so you have to wait to get in.  That is how I pretty much feel about Rokerij.  I made the mistake of telling my soon to be ex husband about it (prior D day) and now I have to worry about him showing up with HIS gf and I am there with.... someone.  Sooo.. that being said, I really like this restaurant.  Can I tell you tho that I ONLY go downstairs to eat.  Waaay cooler.  Stairs are a little tricky down... kinda thinkin that they are not up to code and an accident waiting to happen...maybe I could get a free meal?  Hmm.. ok, back to the restaurant.  The downstairs bar is a funky copper and there are 2 seats in front of the big fireplace (I never get the chance to sit there darn it) and all the seating in the restaurant (upstairs and down)is booth.  Love that.  Much more cozy.   Their wine selection is pretty good.  I pretty much have the Klinker Brick red all the time.  My fave dish there is their cornflake crusted halibut w/ salsa.  Deelish!  And their corn side is amazing.. roasted corn and the main man and I were stabbing each other over it.  He always has the mashed potatoes as a side and they come in this little kettle that is super hot. Just warnin you.  I am not much of a potato person but he says that they are good so I will have to take his word.  I even like their house salad.. has chunks of bleu cheese and if I remember right, cranberries.  Btw, Rokerij, you used to have spiced pecans in the salad too but they are gone.  I have a very sad face right now .   Sooo.. that's what I think.. the Rokerij is  a great date place (but only plan on bringing someone you are really into otherwise later when you break up you may have an embarrassing encounter there) and perfect for the holidays!

OrlhPP0S2s5geDEbfA9-jQ.text: Ate here while in town on business. A local friend took us and the food was delicious! Really fun atmosphere - perfect for friends catching up with one another. The service was quite slow but friendly. I would love to go back and wish we had this restaurant back home!

JNjnkSTKN7EhsyvwiFLf0g.text: this place looks really nice.  The ambiance was great, but the food blechk!  I ordered the lamb and it was basically just fat.  My Beau ordered the schnitzel and it was salty.  Our waitress was rude, and our bill was 100!  (2 entrees a bottle of wine and 1 appetizer)  When we got home my beau was up all night throwing up.  It was horrible!  In their defense after calling several times, they reimburssed our bill.  That was the first time I've ever called and complained anywhere.  I used to be a server so I know how it is sometimes, but this was just terrible!

YU0ECHTnUh25gyfM9W12lw.text: The food is great, the wine list too and the service is decent, but... what do you say to your waiter who tells you your food is delayed because they're busy with a large party upstairs, or when you ask if they have champagne they tell you their three options, bottle only - $72, $220 and $440. Really, I said. Ok, then.  Ok, when I can get a decent bottle of Veuve Cliquot at Safeway for crying out loud for under $50... ?? where am I? oh, right. North of Camelback.  And it's freezing in there, now that it's in the low 60s at night outside, does it really need to be ultra-air conditioned inside? But...I did enjoy the Ferrari Carano, Siena Meritage 06 very much and as usual the beef tenderloin with French brie on toasts was delish! And the veal meatballs rival Lisa g's meatballs not in size but certainly in taste and flavor. My husband had the pasta dish on special, flat ribbon pasta with a cream chipotle sauce, bacon wrapped shrimp...mmh, it was good, but not fantastic.  The service, when you do get it, IS good, I think they were short-handed though - our waiter was also the solo bartender... oh, and another plus Chimay on tap.  p.s....how could I forget!?  THE best caesar salad EVER. I'd go back just for that.

egCqMWr-q7lbH70IFwNX3w.text: Wow, I heard about this small restaurant  from a friend at work so we thought we would give it try . We made reservations for Sunday brunch. On the outside it looks like "nothing special" Inside is small, dark and quaint . The food was amazing!! Real New Mexican style. Chips and home made Guacamole...fabulous!! All plates came with homemade fresh beans. My husband had the Cheese Relleno  and I had the Advodaca, they were fabulous!  My daughter who is 14 and a small, tiny thing not only ate her plate but was forking beans from her brothers plate...This is unheard of. We will so be back !

O-8PY0ElOG5cPFGnEq-nJw.text: Outstanding. 2 restaurants in  one. Check out their Speakeasy celler.  Do make reservations. It Has breakfasts. Great New Mexican/Mexican food & fresh fish. Try the Green Chile Potato. Great wait staff. 6 stars.

AB2py36z2Ptvp5S8KTwUiQ.text: I can't believe it has taken me so long to review! We have been visiting the Rokerij for years now, and it has only gotten better with time.  The Rokerij is actually our favorite Sunday brunch. We come almost every week and sit at the bar top, where Brittany always takes such great care for her patrons. Her bar back is one of the best in town, always keeping glasses of water full and any odds and ends delivered with our meal.  We have had just about everything on the brunch menu. The breakfast burrito is the best bang for your buck, especially with their delectable red sauce and chorizo.   The carne adovada is fabulous. Enjoy it with a side of eggs, or as an egg Benedict dish. Wonderful!!   Of course, their special Dutch pancake is out of this world. So sweet, but with a bit of a crunch on the outside and a fluffy center and served with warmed syrup. If you are ever presented with the opportunity, be sure to order the peppered bacon for an extra special treat with any dish!!

HQTQdsTTnt10y17vGJqQPA.text: My fiancee and I love the hidden away basement bar with its intimate atmosphere and great food. The bacon wrapped jalapenos are amazing. The scallops are impeccable. Their fresh seafood specials are out of this world. This is one of our favorite places to go to relax together. The service is always perfect, making our evenings seamless. A must try!

XWsikMvPVfsvDA-4SSRIVg.text: I first discovered this place last year for a friend's birthday party and have been back 4 times since. All of my other visits were 5 star food and service. My in-laws were visiting and we decided to take them last night. We had a great table next to the fireplace. Food was delicious as usual. The service was absolutely awful. The waitress acted like we were inconveniencing her by being there. She hardly came over to check on us. The other staffers were eager to help fill our glasses and get us to go boxes, but the waitress never checked to see if our food was good or we needed anything. She even spoke like she didn't give a shit. I was so eager to share this place with our family and it backfired. We had to apologize for a birthday dinner spoiled by the attitude of a crappy waitress. I won't lie and say I'll never be back, but it definitely won't be on the top of my list for a nice night out. The 3 stars is for the food and all other staff. The waitress gets zero stars.

hOouz4GCI1fOtc1La_J4RQ.text: A colleague insisted on a lunch here, I was skeptical at first but as we descended into the dungeon-esque bar area I felt a sweep of cool air and the smell of greasy food. And these are two of my favorite things *queue music*  The basement bar area was so crisp and cool on at 120+ degree day in Phoenix. The bartender greeted us as we entered and urged us to sit where we wanted. It was dim but reminded me of pubs in Ireland. We picked a cushy, big booth and got comfortable. The menu was different, all day brunch for example, and your typical Mexican fare.   Ordered a salad and a cheese enchilada, all entree plates come on a tortilla. Food was not as good as I had hoped it would be, but the atmosphere made up for it.

WzjHbAdfquPgPMax7Ff2SA.text: Sad day to be giving this restaurant 3 stars! I came for my 2 year anniversary and I've been here 2 times in the past. Always highly impressed previously! Hence why I wanted to spend a special night there. I'm not a picky diner but when paying a hefty price I definitely anticipate at least the fundamentals of good service. I felt like we were judged because we were a young couple. Our server didn't offer the specials, yet offered them to the table right next to us. Which is disappointing because I typically always go for a special.. I would have asked but didn't know they were offering one until it was offered to the table next to us. My bf's beer came flat. The filet was mediocre at best and the highest price I've paid compared to Fleming's and The House Brasserie(great places for a filet). My double butter mashed potatoes were so starchy and bland definitely not double butter in my opinion. And our server never came to ask how our food was.  I think things have gone down hill a bit since my previous experiences. I'd like to say I'd be back again but not so sure. Maybe for happy hour.

hv2o0Rv-7QUkcdM8XMwBLA.text: OMG the happy hour Rokerij burger for $8 is amazing the best bacon mushroom and guereye cheese and fries and a fresh bun yum yum.

sNov0b2PVJzs8FxEwr3GWQ.text: Went in for reverse happy hour. The space is super cute, food is excellent and vibe is fantastic.  I loved it and have returned twice since my first visit.

VayzAYwaIBAHzsB5qC02Ow.text: Extremely disappointed in Richardson's and the Rokerij. We stopped in today for lunch and asked for a table. There were at least 4 open tables, the larger tables, but still they were open. The bartender and then the hostess were only willing to seat us at the bar since we were a party of two. We were looking for a sit down lunch in which we planned to eat and enjoy several drinks.  We walked out after realizing the staff had no desire to accommodate us or concern for losing a customer. We decided to go down to the Rokerij to see if the attitude was different there. It was complete empty yet all the tables said reserved.  We asked the bartender if we could sit at a table. He had to excuse himself to go upstairs to ask permission. That was enough for us. There are too many good places to eat in Phoenix.  Oh by the way, until today we were loyal regulars to all three Richardson's restaurants.

w07f-9BWvoXF4gth8LGq7Q.text: Okay, I am absolutely in love with this restaurant! I've had the pleasure of dining here 4 or 5 times. It's so intimate & cozy... Perfect for a date night! The food is always superb too. The last time I had the Pine nut crusted Chilean sea bass with an orange chili glaze with asparagus, & a Green chile potato (a twice-baked and whipped potato stuffed into a roasted green chile). Total mouth-gasm! The blackened sea scallops were also excellent. Good food, good wine, good friends, good service- what else could you possibly want?

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Blackened sea scallops
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pine nut crusted Chilean sea bass with an orange chili glaze... asparagus, &amp; a Green chile potato!

H9mk8I9s2eVeI04gCHXWfg.text: We love Dick's Hideaway and have gone several times but have not ventured north to Rokerij. I have heard that they are comparably but just in a more romantic and cozy setting. So for our recent date night, we thought we'd drive pass Dick's and give Rokerij a try.  The menu is similar, actually maybe a little more extensive. They have a larger selection of entrees and fish specials of the day. They have a little more than half of what Dick's offer and then some. I had a really hard time deciding because they had so many specials. I opted for the fish trio so I can have a variety of flavors. The BF didn't venture far and went for the usual Carne Adovada.   I felt all my fish with their accompanied sauces were very mild. I have had several fish dishes at Dick's and they all have been heavy seasoned and flavorful - exactly what you expect from a New Mexican restaurant. I didn't get that here. My BF's Carne Adovada was identical to Dick's so he enjoyed his meal.  I'm not sure if I would come back. I think I will stick to Dick's. It's a tiny bit closer, slightly lower cost but most importantly tastes better! I can only see myself picking Rokerij over Dick's if I'm looking for better ambiance.

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Adovada
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish Trio: Trout, Swordfish (favorite) &amp; Mahi Mahi

C4zwJfQYcKG3XT1mVcOJfA.text: Both the food and the service were very good. We will definitely be returning. It's got a cute little Ambiance also.

mM69cafVtjO9ddHsUaJfBA.text: My wife and are are in Phoenix for a few days and tried this spot just on a chance. The valet told us there are two restaurants but to trying going down to the basement room. We did and found the coziest little bar room. My wife had delicious blackened scallops that came with four different sauces on the plate.  They were tender and perfectly cooked with a smokey and spicy crust. I had the bone-in prime rib with smoked beets cooked medium rare.  It was as perfect as prime rib can be.  Highly recommend this place.

3n9w0LiRAX0fFMgtLaktBA.text: This place has a similar menu as Dick's Hideaway. The stone downstairs area is lovely. They have good wine selection. Good thing about dining downstairs is the cell phone reception is not so good. It's good for friends to hangout without staring at the phone. In general, Dick's hideaway is a better experience than Rokerij.

ho0KKeX9PAAlMVqnkCeRVg.text: Amazing service, amazing food and could not be a better ambience. Took my husband here for his birthday and they took such amazing care of us. We loved our food and can't wait to go back with our friends and family.

m0CT_wa2iRSaOitModq-hQ.text: After reading several reviews on Yelp, we had to try this place. Any restaurant that has a Dutch name yet is classified as a Mexican restaurant definitely piques one's fancy. Having found a space to park in the rather small parking lot, our group headed toward the entrance. Arriving there we had a choice, straight ahead or down the stairs into the bowels of the earth. An easy decision as the stairs reminded me of an English castle I once visited. At the bottom of the stairs, the view we were offered was delightfully reminiscent of an old English pub (I'm not getting a Dutch vibe yet!). As there were no tables that did not have reserved signs on them, we decided to sit at the bar (great decision) and managed to find four seats at the end (or beginning if you have just entered the restaurant). We ordered a bottle of wine, because it was happy hour (half price), and perused the menu. As we couldn't decide which wine to order, the bar person, Nicole, gave us a couple of samples so it was much easier to decide. Everything looked tasty and what we ordered was delightful. Of the three dishes we ordered, the pecan grilled trout was the winner although nobody complained about anything, as all the plates were empty before we left and we were all stuffed. A close second were the carne adovada and the parppardelle with duck. (Nothing came third as two people ordered the carne adovada). The cauliflower and brussel sprouts were melt-in-your-mouth yummy. As we were eating, the restaurant filled up so I would recommend reservations as the eating area is not very large. Overall, this was a great meal and this place ranks highly on my places where I need to eat again (and again). As we left, I considered whether this was really a Dutch restaurant and I have to conclude that it is because the Dutch really know how to make food taste great.

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Parppardelle with a side order of Brussel sprouts.
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Isn&#39;t it obvious!

fmsNzF2FK_a3qkMfBXiowA.text: I love brunch on the weekend and Rokerij has been my hot spot lately. You can get anything from French toast to enchiladas for brunch. Portions are huge and the food is delicious. Mimosas are cheap and I like that they don't use cheap champagne to make them but watch out for the Bloody Mary's they're spicy! I prefer to eat in the basement where it's dark. Perfect if you're nursing a hangover! Just don't plan on doing anything after because you will be in a serious food coma!

DRMPhaYst1anKcZy93U-yw.text: Food was ok, just don't go during lunch hours. They have a small selection. My other issue was the fact that it was dead during lunch time and so was the service, it was like a ghost town. Why did it take so long to get our food? We got here before 230pm and I am writing my review at 430pm I just walked out. I wouldn't come back here because the food isn't that great to wait that long. We have a flight to catch and figured an hour and a half would be enough time. Come here if you have 4 hours to spare. And if you like ok food.

NALtxf5vZaqZ7oE3j6IAuw.text: I am visiting from Boston and wanted to try something a bit high end in the Phoenix area. I had dinner on New Years Eve with reservations and let me tell you ... the service was terrible and the restaurant was not busy at all, our server forgot to mention about a certain food being in one of their specials which should not happen as someone in the party had a food allergy. When the food came out, it came out at different times and a couple of us at the table had to wait while our food got cold waiting for the others' food to come out. I ordered a glass of Cabernet and IT CAME OUT COLD.. when I asked why, they told me the owner likes to chill his red wines so they chill them......WHAT. Our food took an hour to come out. When it came out, the asparagus was undercooked on 2 of 3 plates.. for 3 at dinner it came to $200 and when I asked to speak to a manager... he sent the waitress back in to speak with us and refused to speak to us.. overall, fucking pathetic meal and restaurant.

uvhS6KAW-KUvNaW0Ltw4Mw.text: My husband and I have been wanting to try this place for a while so today on our way home from Scottsdale we stopped in around 330-4ish for a late lunch/early dinner.  The forced valet parking is definitely a con.  This is especially True because they were not even remotely busy at this time.  Our second turn off was that all of the tables around the bar area downstairs were marked reserved.  We were told by the bartender that we could not sit there because of it and had to sit at the bar instead.  The entire time we were there not one person came in to sit down at the reserved tables.  I have dined out all over the place in many different cities and many types of restaurants and this was a first.  I understand that people make reservations and restaurants choose to accept them.  However, I have never seen it where all of the tables are reserved for the entire night and staff refuses to let you sit at one of the many empty tables.  I'm sure this place does get busy later on on Saturday night, but we were long gone by then.  As far as food goes, the crab stuffed mushrooms were good, but cold.  The mako shark and brussel sprouts were tasty.  However, the quality of the food did not match the prices in my opinion.  The bar area is in a basement that is encased by stone walls so the atmosphere is cozy cool.  Overall this place is worth trying, but it probably won't blow your mind.

yyVwgkLlzw9H5lYEtsdMsw.text: The bacon wrapped filet with fresh crab meat on top is the most amazing thing they have there - to me anyways. I love this place. My fiance and I go here all of the time because the food is phenomenal and the service has never been poor. Definitely a must try if you live in the valley!

C6VL2aHbEM3NeXCPZ4Gp_Q.text: WOW. I write short reviews when a place is so good. This is one of the best meals I've had. Order the roasted garlic plate to start, and then take their advice on your entree. They only offer two desserts. Order both.

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flour-less Chocolate Cake
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Roasted Garlic Plate
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Creme brûlée

TfGdnqAf3NrSjcjTl0FlRw.text: Terrible experience, will never go back.  The restaurant was 30% capacity max.  Kitchen slow and inconsistent.  Had to ask for our sides.  The meal did not come as advertised, severed with shrimp and ordered King Crab.  Server said she would give discount but never did and reminder her twice.  Poor service and management could care less.

JudvlygTMlP79xkqQYH-MQ.text: I have to say I agree with a couple of the other reviews.  I SO want to like this place - the atmosphere is amazing, but the food and service will keep me away.  Went there once again the other day and sat at the bar as it was still early enough to get a seat.  Waited about 10 minutes for someone to take our drink order - not a huge deal as we were there to relax and in no hurry - but at Hillstone someone would have taken our drink order in 1 minute.   Could just be me, the music was too loud and too catering to a 20 something crowd.  Doesn't fit the cool vibe of the space and sounds like the bartender or dishwasher selected the music.  Ordered 3 small plates.  Calamari was cold.  Shrimp dish with toast was best and toast with mushrooms could be SO much better.  Overall, below average.  Ordered desert - chocolate torte - which was impossible to eat as it felt like it just came out of the freezer.  It needed one hour of defrost time.  To his credit, our server took that off our bill (without our asking, so good job there).  Overall, atmosphere is great.  But, that's it.

BNckOCe8vU_biseLEGYgoA.text: Great service, delectable food, awesome atmosphere... What more can a girl say?  Venture to the basement -via a gorgeous stone-framed stairwell or the semi-sketchy elevator- for a cozy cabin feel and be sure to check out their specials (on the chalkboard)!  I dined there with a group of four on a Friday night and my entree came out later than the others, so our Server ended up comping our dessert, which was both unexpected and extremely accommodating.   Get creative, because the Rokerij boasts a full bar, but no Cocktail List; or simply go for a glass of vino.  For a filling and mouth-watering entree, try the Rokerij Steak, Chimoy Chicken, or Red Chile Pasta.  Got a sweet tooth?  The Creme Brulee is guaranteed to put a smile on your face.  I pinky swear that this place is unlike any other Valley eatery...  Foodies, ASU students, and even Snobsdale peeps unite!  This is the place for you!

laOKB32dlxOMRXarHmbjcA.text: Finally made it to Rokerij and LOVED it! We will definitely be back. We sat downstairs in an intimate booth overlooking the bar. It was a perfect night out with my husband (date night away from the kids). We got the salmon and the duck. Best duck I've ever had. It was done to perfection! The stuffed pepper for the side was delicious.  The atmosphere was very welcoming and the service was top notch.   On Friday night, self-park was not an option, but that was fine with us. I had read previous reviews so valet parking was not a surprise to us.  Total experience was great and will be visiting again, very soon.

YfZvOmRM-sqbhGxPVsfymg.text: Great restaurant, good food, service and atmosphere. Very upscale and wonderful place to go for a date or for business meeting dinner.

S4Eoxek-FypYyR9OnpII_Q.text: Wonderful place. We went nuts and ordered about everything on the menu because of a $250 gift card we were using. I'm not sure there was anything I DIDN'T like. True gourmet cooking for very reasonable prices. We will be back.

2SziVSSx_neuwUI6I3Z2Ew.text: Yes! Green and red chile.. muy rico! Stick to the offerings with chile.. not impressed with $50 sea bass.. tasted like imitation crab ( krab). Had rellenos for breakfast and they were cold inside.. those were the only 2 bad experiences but the 20 other times I was there have been great.. nice speak easy downstairs for a date.. great atmosphere.. busy on the weekends, call ahead.

vDmyoWS1jf8etMsQjZolTA.text: Happy hour is great if you can fight your way over to a seat at the bar. Otherwise, this place ain't that special.

HeRv-h7tNyAln4jmpGuyNw.text: I  recently took some friends to  the Rokerij for diner. Frankly I couldn't have been more disappointed. We were there on a Thursday evening and the restaurant wasn't crowded. The service was very extremely slow from drinks through dinner. We ordered 2 appetizers  that came to the table 1/2 apart. The dinner order was taken incorrectly so when the food arrived the servings were incorrect and cold. one person in my party had a food allergy and the food served was combined improperly and had to be sent back. To be fair the. manager removed that meal from our bill but it wasn't enough to make up for the slow services, cold food and poor attention. I don't think we will visit this restaurant again.

ZffEv0SAskuTs68EnPPYSw.text: Excellent. We had a mushroom bread appetizer. It melted in your mouth.  I had the duck special.  The portions were large and delicious.

cT2fMPizqsDfZ6bOCb6niw.text: Love the food and the atmosphere! There is also a fantastic little hidden bar downstairs, it always feels like we are sneaking in. It's dark inside with lots of private booths, just like at Richardson's next door. It does get busy sometimes, so a reservation would help.

jnhWzcF8TlYJYjbJeRovWw.text: Rokerij is easily our favorite place to eat when we go to Phoenix! Family, friends, all ask when are we going to go here when we do our annual Arizona trip. Amazing food and drinks, with very generous sized portions and always a friendly staff. Can't go wrong with a lunch or dinner plate! We will come back here every year, as well as tell others how great this place is!

r_DJkt5ha_H_6Cmy96BavA.text: Tonight my bf and I went for the first time as a recommendation from a friend, and boy were we blown away! Not only were we greeted immediately as we walked in but were able to sit at the bar to grab a drink while we waited for our table....AJ the bar tender greeted us with a very warm welcome and after reviewing the drink menu with us we decided to skip the table reservation and stay at the bar, as we were so impressed with the service we received from AJ and his knowledge as well. We informed him it was our first visit and he went above and beyond to insure that we would become life long patrons.  I, myself was looking forward to trying the prime rib.... Unfortunately they were out(because it must be amazing) however, I ordered the pepper steak based on AJ's advice and was not disappointed one bit. Amazing! After our meals, he gave us a tour of the unique surroundings and went out of his way to stay past his scheduled shift to guarantee our satisfaction. We will most definitely be back because the food and drinks are incredible but more importantly due to the service we received from AJ and the rest of the crew. Everyone that we interacted with was amazing! Even the customers. :)

I6xSsPI0ykv6eXaXP7EECA.text: One star for the environment very laid back and classy. Food on the other hand was not quality that we expected. Enchiladas were over powered by cheese and too soggy, and runny eggs. The tenderloin we asked medium rare definitely no taste nor quality the taste of the raw meat was not pleasing. Cocktails were not up to par either. Although service was great one more star.

Wwgm-9f-N7d3fQIdWJVXTQ.text: I've always wanted to go to Rokerij and when my date suggested it last night - I was all for it!  I was NOT disappointed.    We spent our evening downstairs in what I can only describe as "speak-easy" atmosphere reminiscent of my days spent in the DC area.  I loved it.  Decor was spot on with stone walls, a fire place with comfy leather chairs strategically placed in front.  A big bar took up most of the room with some comfy look booths placed around the outskirts of the room. Lots of great details in decorations and design.  Our bartender was friendly and efficient. His suggestions on wine (1/2 price bottle!) and the manhattan we had were spot on.  He checked in with us and was attentive, but not overly so, letting us enjoy each other's company.    We tried 3 of the small plates:  the roasted pepper bruschetta, tenderloin skewers and the bacon wrapped shrimp.  Honestly, I was expecting to be hungry afterwards and was ready to order something else in addition to that, but we held off until we received our food and I'm glad we did. The portions were pretty large and food rich.  Everything tasted great...the bacon and tenderloin were served on long plates that had 3 different sauces...a creamy queso (I think), a spicy red sauce and a green tomatillo-like sauce.  The red and green were really good - the white was a bit bland....but I'm also not a fan of cream sauces, so don't take my word for it.  The bruschetta was more of an italian style bruschetta (bread, peppers layered on top with melted cheese).  Tasted good, but my only complaint would be that it got a little mushy because there was so much topping on it. My date enjoyed it.  Overall, a great experience. I can't wait to go back - especially when looking for a laid back, cool atmosphere. And I definitely want to try more of the food!

2nL1lYqM4MIh5jyS3DfYbw.text: I work near the Rokerij, so my coworker and I have gone for lunch several times. We always get the prime rib sliders and the bacon wrapped scallops. Anything wrapped in bacon is worth a try, and we thought these were very good.   Decided to try the Rokerij for dinner with some friends. We went downstairs to the basement which was very cool. It was crowded, and the servers were very nice, but it took some time to get our food.   The best part of the Rokerij is that they sell my favorite wine by the bottle. I cannot find it anywhere else in town, so that is a big plus for me.

zL2yLd7jt_mQu-i1DNGiSQ.text: As usual, Rokerij doesn't disappoint.  We had a party of 7 and sat in the cellar in one of the booths which fit us well.  We had a vegetarian in our group and with mostly meat and fish dishes served we were a little worried she wouldn't find much to suit her tastes. Steven our server was great and pointed out so many options to her. She left full, satisfied and can't wait to go back for more. Others in our group had Lamb, Pork and SeaBass.  As usual it was delicious and did not dissapoint!  The servings are large so expect you may go home with a to-go box.  Wine list is great but if you prefer a cocktail they really know how to make them. We love the Rokerij and will visit the cellar again as well as Richardsons patio once this summer heat goes away. Keep up the good work Rokerij.

HsG49tKqmvFMqYxwwJJexA.text: Went for the first time recently. I would give 5 stars, but as first timers, it was clear that the day we went, the bartender really catered to the regulars. And there could not have been more than 6 customers in the whole place not including us at the time. Meanwhile, us newbies sat for 5 minutes without being greeted as she looked at us and still yucked it up with her co-worker and the regulars. Not serving them. Just talking.   Once she finally greeted us, she was no longer the smiling happy person that was just talking to the regulars and coworker. Instead, she was dry, cold and unwelcoming. She went through the motions. Never smiled. And forgot part of our order.   Another table of non regulars came in and sat and they got the same dry, cold treatment we got. All this time she would bounce back to the regulars with smiles and small talk. Hoping the management is reading these reviews. There is a theme of bad attitude and bad service from the staff at Rokerij in many posts here on yelp. It really ruins the experience at your restaurant.  Thank goodness for the food. It was amazing. We had several appetizers and a couple of the benedicts. Everything was very good. My only complaint about the food was the calamari was not too warm when served but it was still good  We look forward to coming back with hopes of having a better experience from the staff.

WiBX1ClQNwBLKxYZ9JG7Uw.text: The pasta Heidi far exceeded my wildest dreams! I am a Green Chile fanatic and this pasta was superb! Cooked to a perfect al dente, with a velvety savory chipotle cream sauce! Must try!

yczg5gcIFwhoME1zozWYyg.text: We have been coming here for years so I guess it is past due for a review.  We used to go there almost every week because there was a really nice bartender that we enjoyed visiting with her but one days she was gone.  We asked what happened but the new bartenders never heard of her!  Weird.  They also changed up the parking a little making it very difficult to park unless you use the Valet which I will never use forced Valet so many times we'd drive in and then drive away.  Since most people hate forced Valet it is a mystery why anybody would use it here.  Guess they don't care that much about what their customers want.  There is an upstairs and a downstairs which is very intimate with a nice fireplace.  Most of the seating is at the bar and the bartenders are very friendly and will engage in conversation which we like.  Speaking of the bar they have a pilsner not tap from Helton Brewing Company, a local brewery which is as good as it gets!  I'm going to have to check them out!  I wish they still had Guiness because it was always good there.  They finally got Chimay there. They also have some good wine too.  The food can be hit or near miss, never bad but just OK.  The trout was alway one of my favorites until they increased the price by $8 so can't justify that anymore. None of the other entrees I tried there I can say were outstanding.   Recently we went there and walked through the upstairs and saw a bone in prime rib on the spit.  I had to try that for $36.  It is hard to find excellent prime rib around these parts but i thought how can you go wrong cooking it on a spit?  I was a little disappointed because it was just all right.   I have to say many of the entrees are just OK but the sides are very good, love the beets and brussels sprouts.  The apps tend to be better and priced right for happy hour.  I will probably just stick to the apps from now on since I feel the entrees are just too expensive for what you get.  Their pan seared salmon app is to die for though.  We get it every time except last visit when they were out.  The calamari is also very good, crispy but tender.

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Midwestern
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very crispy calamari!
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prime rib over pecan

Z1Y44pkHq8ViYxUlC1Rs-g.text: I love the atmosphere! It's a great place to have drinks and hors d'oeuvres. I love to eat at Dick's personally (it's the other restaurant he owns that's just down the street). Really hip cool place, and they're not afraid to poor you a real drink! I love it and need to go back.

v87TjYfoBtjQemdZRwhftQ.text: This was my second visit to the Rokerij. I took my wife there for our anniversary because we liked the atmosphere and the food was good too. After some wine we ordered the bacon wrapped jalapenos stuffed with cheese. I normally have a high tolerance for spicy heat but after a bite my wife said they were all mine. After consuming 3 very large and extremely tasty peppers I was already regretting the next day's visit to the restroom.  After those tasty treats I ordered more wine and the enchiladas with a fried egg on top with the green sauce. I loved every savory minute of it.  Looking forward to trying something different on our next visit.

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Candle lit dinner in the Rokerij cellar

a88O15vxG5swkn9wWsnNjg.text: Four stars for the waitress. Four stars for the food... Great, fresh, hot. The best part was the chef cooked it right in front of us. One star deduction for the chef on the other side of the bar eating without washing his hands and preparing someone else's food.... Yuck

Mr9m-1ptnvlMTFec0sAFfw.text: This was one of the best restaurants I have dined at in a while. The menu is extremely diverse and the environment is dimly lit perfection. The liquor, wine & spirit selection is to die for. I could have spent the whole night here. I will definitely be back again.  I almost did not write a review , I almost wanted to keep this precious diamond to myself. This place is a tad pricey but that is easily forgotten once you taste the food. So worth it!

Btwxho_CLfEXwklDcZvO0A.text: Loved this place! Cozy atmosphere. The cooking is visible to patrons, especially if seated at the bar. Flavors are wonderful, presentation is beautiful. So many choices. It all looked amazing. The scallops appetizer and four meat skewers were to die for!

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Flourless chocolate cake
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. One of their awesome starter salads
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fish trio

2svMsjkUhFDMV6r5p8H4kw.text: If you love New Mexican Cuisine, head to Rokerij/Richardson's - its in the same space. The Red Bird enchiladas and eggs are really delicious! Service was a little slow and it was a little dark inside for brunch time, but the food is worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Red bird chicken enchiladas with eggs over medium, huge portions!

1heJgxq6o_BTLFGkk6J6HQ.text: Felt the loss of Chef Arturo tonight. The crew is clearly working hard. Service was good though food took excessively long. Little more chaotic than we're used to seeing. Team is working hard.... continues to be a favorite and am sure they will  work through it. Arturo was fabulous. Bringing back the Shrimp Piri Piri might help make things better!!

ZLcRbyUMPBaKsH65D0ns6w.text: We have been eating at the Richardson's family of restaurants for years. Last night we shared the fish trio! It was delicious!!  We usually don't have room for dessert, but thought we would try the cheesecake. We were disappointed. It was a little ramekin filled with cheesecake. For $8 I thought it would have been a large slice of cheesecake. We will stick to the fabulous entrees.

Il1jLFOWs7u3jwV-72WR9Q.text: This place just made it to one of my favorite steakhouses in Phoenix. The staff was friendly and our waitress was very knowledgeable. She provided great recommendations and was happy to accommodate our specific dietary needs. To start off, we ordered the steak tartare. I was amazed on how good it was, although a very simple dish to make, many places fail to use the right ingredients (type of meat, seasonings, type of bread), this place nailed it. As our main entree we ordered the prime rib. This prime rib has got to be the best prime rib I've had in a long time. First of all, the cut was so big I couldn't even finish half of it. It was cooked perfectly to order and seasoned exquisitely. Loved this place, I will definitely be coming back!

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States

PIOogDJNBCj6D-SenJKa-A.text: My girlfriend surprised me with birthday dinner here when we got back in town.   We ate at the bar and the drinks were incredible.  We both had steak options and shared.  Great choice of sides and a very cool vibe.

T007-AVsAkEAfv0KFkXVhg.text: I was in a couple of weeks ago with a small group.  We sat at a booth in the downstairs bar area.  The downstairs is a nice cozy place with a fireplace going on cold, rainy nights.  The server was friendly but there were a number of glitches while we were having dinner.  My friends split an order of prime rib and asked for horseradish when they ordered.  The prime rib came out without the horseradish and she had to wait a good ten minutes for it to arrive.  By then the meat was getting cold.  I had the rack of lamb and it was pretty good.  We told the server that we were splitting this between the two of us.  There was never a second plate brought so we wiped off the plate left on the table from an appetizer and made do with that as the second plate.  The food here is very good but they seemed a little short-staffed and the service suffered.

ox-Y2oW5XPhsJWI7Fb7Zrg.text: Not bad but not as good as I expected.  I had the spicy chicken tostadas, which were ok.  Followed that up with a NY Strip and it was just smothered in a ridiculous amount of mushroom glaze.  You shouldn't need to smother the steak like that.  The steak was charred on the outside which is fine but a little lacking in tenderness and flavor.  I frequent Fleming's often and the steaks are much better.  I would go again if the price tag was about half what it was, but for that price I expect much more.

WlzA9YQd6hakxgNvo38mzg.text: Food was amazing and so was the staff, downstairs bar is the best  definitely try the roasted garlic plate.

-FJN5wlkmWWxPDLv0q_BvA.text: The dark, romantic feel of this restaurant makes for an enchanted evening... if you have a loved one of course.  I'll start by saying I would give 5 stars but I don't like that I can't make reservations otherwise get stuck awkwardly waiting to be seated because the bar is full as well. Perhaps that's a me problem.  Regardless, I love this place. It has the feel of a speakeasy but serves delicious food. And there's a very cool bar downstairs which is my preference  to be seated.  We sat at the bar in the upstairs unit and had the most attentive and sweet bartender. She never faltered even though she was busy as hell. We ordered past martinis from her that were so delightful followed by an order of calamari. They had a slight peppered flavor which made them that much better.  For entrees, I ordered a special of the branzino with green chili potato and brussel sprouts which didn't disappoint. My other half ordered the pork chop (ewe. Not a fan of pork)... with mash potatoes and brocolini. He bragged of that. I so look forward to coming back. I just hope we get a spot in the mysterious downstairs basement next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nightly special of branzino in a lemon butter caper sauce, brussel sprouts and green chili potato (drool)
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pork chop with broccolini and mashed potatoes that my other half demolished. Don&#39;t forget the martini!

n0kygIl1nRuFALTQtVhb8w.text: Dinner was wonderful. Service was wonderful. We were visiting from California and the next day I realized my work phone was missing. I was very concerned. Kate answered the phone, scanned the restaurant for my phone and even offered to drop it at our hotel, but we were too far. Anyway, a destination restaurant when you are in Phoenix and a place that cares. Thank you so much. We picked up my work phone the morning we drove back to California.

7ECkbIMcvnzP8hv1qud_9g.text: Come here for drinks in the basement bar. Overpriced cuts of meat and meh service. My wife liked the scallops, I had the bacon wrapped filet, it was just meh...

PQ14lhmrOOCIR-sorAPR1g.text: My favorite place to dine the price for the food here is on point . The quality is amazing I personally recommend the pork chop .

w70LmAHwwUcgiJFxXhIKFg.text: If you are looking to move to the next level of Mexican food this is your place.  It's True New Mexican cuisine that will give your taste buds next level stuff.   Our family has been dining at Richardson Browns Restuarants for years.  He and his team do an outstanding job on all aspects of what a great restaurant should deliver.   They have three units under different names and I highly recommend any of them.  Richardson's, Dicks Hideaway and Rokerij.  Solid happy hour offers with new items being rotated in and out to keep it fresh and fun.   We have hosted many folks from all over the world and this restaurant has left a memorable impression on all of them.  In fact, several of our friends have revisited us and the first thing they ask is if we can go back to the restaurant(s).

WzgGqmbQrUyJ4Q0D6HlQPw.text: NOT MEXICAN - wish they would fix this.  I went for happy hour which is weeknights after 10pm and also earlier I believe.   You can have their amazing appetizers for only $5. You have to sit at the bar but that's great. That's where they cook the food!  Everything was delicious: seafood, meat, vegetables.  It is almost impossible to get in for dinner on a Fri/Sat night. They get busy.

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Happy Hour Check! 5 apps and 1 wine
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oysters rokerij
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oyster rokerij

DRbXG87g799uuZBHX4awMA.text: Up until the last few visits this restaurant was my favorite restaurant in Phoenix.  Lately the quality and preparation of food has taken a nose dive.  The meat preparation (cooked incorrectly) and quality of cuts have been sub-par for a restaurant that charges roughly $25 - $40 per main dish.    If you want to have a nice appetizer and glass of wine, this is a great place.  If you want to get a nice meat dish or southwestern cuisine I recommend spending your money at a different place unless you live nearby.  The valley is flooded with similar restaurants and you money is better spent elsewhere for a nice meal.

y_q2frYbMT_JuclT7iF9Cg.text: No alterations! Nicht! I have out-of-town guests and always like them to experience the wonderful food and service at the Rokerij. I was craving my favorite Carne Adovada (pork roast dish), however I usually replace the rice and beans with some of their fresh seasonal vegetables. Not this time! Apparently the kitchen can't handle changing out sides (as of a couple months ago). So had to completely switch gears and figure out a new direction very quickly as rice & beans are not my friends.  As expected the meal was delightful but still craving my Carne!!

s9RxNNe3VC7IZIL6odUWvQ.text: Reverse happy hour by the fire was a perfect way to end a great date night. Still can't get over how great the creme brule is!

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dessert sampler with 2 creme brûlées &amp; a chocolate cake. Too hard to share that creme brûlée!

DT1hosW60pAwkAu7KCcH3Q.text: This place has really changed. After this visit, I'm pretty sure that it's no longer one of my favorite places to go in CenPho.  They took all of the good things off of the appetizer menu, and what we did have was bland. The red wine was also chilled way too cold. My Malbec didn't have that great of a flavor because it was too cold. Oh well, on to the next...

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Sriracha chicken skewers, over rice, with a Malbec.

TYuy-kcsi1ELsKDSxbowAA.text: Even if the food weren't good this place would get 4 stars just for the atmosphere which is just luxe.  The fireplaces, the stone surround, copper-topped bars are da bomb!   They have great happy hour specials for food and wine and the regular menu items are delicious substantive tasty

VaHcP5KwEnueNqXB5wCgqQ.text: I've been back in Phoenix for 6 days, and I've been to the Rokerij 3 times- that is how much I love this place!  It's been a while since I've eaten dinner here, but I do remember loving the green chili potato and the mashed potatoes.I also tried the flatbread with shrimp, and while I was skeptical, it was actually really good. Even my seafood-hating mom liked it.  Brunch is amazing! I've only tried the breakfast burrito with bacon and red chili because it is so delicious I can't bring myself to try anything else! I've heard from friends the enchiladas are also quiet tasty. The mimosa is pretty good and not too sweet, but it is kind of pulpy.  Happy hour is also great. Small plates are $5. Just make sure you get the blue crab tostadas- they are probably one of my favorite things I have ever eaten! The steak tartare and bacon wrapped scallops are also great choices. My mom likes the tacos, but I thought they were just alright. Sunday, Monday, and Tuesday also means 1/2 bottles of wine! How can you pass that up?  Upstairs has big booths and is quieter, but I love the cellar bar. Great music, and the fireplace is awesome. There are a few booths downstairs too. It does get crowded though, so get there early and snag yourself a seat!

6MUyAnqVPQR5bY45GQArWw.text: Love the smells in this place! Came here for brunch on Sunday and they didn't disappoint. Had a couple mimosas and a Bloody Mary(6 bucks each for brunch). They have a great champagne pour for the mimosas so it's worth it! Today we ordered the gruyere steak sandwich with green and red chili on the side. I don't know when they changed their French fries but they were disappointing (super thick cut). Enjoyed their enchiladas which never disappoints. Our party tried one of the specials on the board "rokerij benedict" which included a beef tenderloin with fresh crab on top. Our friend enjoyed his meal, but said it was huge so you could definitely split. Lastly, we ordered the French toast which came on French baguettes and was very appetizing. Overall, this place always delivers. We prefer to go to their other location (dicks hideaway) because their chili seems to always be a little hotter. Complementary valet like most places around the valley which is super annoying. We had to wait 5 mins for our car that we could literally take 15 steps to get too. Wish that would go away.

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States

eVzGrnsBMeuQd3a9r86WAQ.text: We go to Richardson's usually and decided to give the other side a shot. The downstairs bar and lounge is awesome and quiet. Totally opposite of Richardson's. The menu is basically a steak house menu with some of the same apps as next door. The Green Chili Stroganoff was fantastic! My husband ordered the half duck and it was melt in your mouth amazing.

rtB81TiX-36guZ4TNFWEvw.text: Been here a couple of times.  And while the vibe is cool and the cuisine is pretty darn good, the glaring red flag for me about this place is the high prices.  My date had not been here before so I happily brought her by.  It had been about 9 months since my last trip here and I faintly remembered the food being on the pricey side, but not to the extent that I would shy away from here.  This place is pretty popular during happy hour as the upstairs bar was packed right as we arrived.  We suspected the same was True of their basement bar as well so we stuck around the main dining area.  If you've been to Richardson's and/or Dick's Hideaway just a stones throw away, then some of the menu will look familiar.  Rokerij however also has a lot of dishes you'd expect to find at a steakhouse or a cafe that often have no New Mexican influence at all.  Such items include oysters, rib eyes, porterhouses, and (oddly) pizzas.  The New Mexican dishes that both Rokerij and Richardson's serve are pretty reasonably priced around $15 each.  But most of the other items run around $30 and up.  Even the appetizers are around $15 a piece.  Not wanting to break the bank, I got a pair of their tapas plates.  I got their prime rib sliders as well as their Carne Adovada sliders.  For $10 a plate you get three sliders each.  I'm pretty convinced the tapas menu is the way to go here.  The portions weren't huge, but large enough to leave me satisfied and you can get a little taste of multiple items.  The Carne Adovada pork mixed with red chile is tender and not too spicy.  The prime rib sliders had just the right amount of horseradish sauce on them, though there wasn't as much meat on those sliders as I expected.  I would love to try some of their blackboard menu items sometime as some of those looked great, but again, pricey.  Perhaps I should've been more prepared to pay the asking price of this place.  The setup of the restaurant is really cool and I like the unique New Mexican twists they put on the everyday grub.  The food has been good both times I've been here, but is it good enough to drop $30/entree?  I'll leave that up to you.  I'd certainly come back here for a special occasion, but this wouldn't be an everyday stop for me.  Too much of a shock to my bank account.

BtDcuG1WE19moDTp6iW8FQ.text: 4 1/2 stars actually...  I really enjoyed Rokerij. Our server David was fantastic, and even though we were seated at the bar for dinner, the level of attentiveness was super. Knowing that we had never eaten at Rokerij, David took the time to explain the menu in detail and made recommendations.  Rokerij has quite the wine and beer list, however I opted for one of the specialty cocktails listed on the board. It was a double berry martini. I guess I was thinking double berry meant double the berries but it actually meant double vodka (I am a rookie, what can I say?)and was far too strong for a girl who likes her alcohol embedded in a concoction that tastes yummy. David must have seen I was struggling to drink this so he very kindly got a tall glass with ice and added some lemonade and then poured my "vodka surprise" on in. Yay! It was much more suitable and I was able to enjoy. :)  I ordered a sirloin steak with roasted corn and their signature potato baked into a green chile. The potato was cold but it tasted good and definitely had a kick. My friend ordered the enchiladas (one steak, one chicken, one shrimp) and loved their dish.  I would definitely go back and try out some of their other dishes, There was so much that looked and sounded good. Sitting at the bar, we could see the food being prepared and everything that came out looked delicious. The portions are very generous at Rokerij. We will be back soon!

f1_eNtDR1wlI_VdyL445Fg.text: I love this place! I like to come here with friends late at night during the week. Weekends can be packed with long wait times. The downstairs bar is a great place to have some drinks and appetizers with friends. Really intimate setting with the dimmed lights and fireplace. We always order the bacon wrapped shrimp, pan seared salmon and prime rib sliders.

PU8wkRVfbzonmhIHnQX1pQ.text: The Rokerij is easily one of the top 3 restaurants in Phoenix. A late night here will make your week better, guaranteed. The ambience is amazing and the food has never disappointed me. I am not someone who eats steak at just any old place. If I'm going for it, I want it to be stellar, and I have never once had a bad steak here. Their halibut is always cooked to perfection and their sweet potato (served in a hatch chile) is so good, it's almost annoying. If you've got a sweet-tooth, they've got the chocolate lovers AND the vanilla babies covered! (The creme brulee is my favorite). You may not get a server that is all puppies and sunshine, but you'll be fine. Just come prepared to waddle out with a smile.

LChOcy-y7MoIFPBTR-0W3A.text: I cannot say enough good things about this restaurant. I've eaten here several times a week for the last 10+ years and have immensely enjoyed every single meal. Yesterday, for the first time, I had the prime rib and it was absolutely heavenly. The best prime rib I've ever experienced in any restaurant anywhere. Fantastic!

9jpIKfVIdXw5RtoUsrGCAg.text: Everyone in the "know" in Phoenix knows about the Rokerji / Richardsons. This place serves the best southwestern food hands down. Ask Esquire magazine, who awarded them best bar in America. And of course Phoenix Mag gives their nod to this place almost every year. These 2 restaurants occupy the same real estate but the Rokerji is in the basement and it is my personal favorite. The atmosphere is 5 stars. Big sofas, large booths in a Grotto like setting with a roaring fire. It doesn't get any better than this. The menu is the same whether you choose to stay up top at Richardsons or go down below to the basement. The food is hands down the best of its kind in town. Now if you are heat sensitive, listen to your server. The owner of these places means it when he says "spicy" but it's oh so worth the pain. My favorite here is the Carne Adovada with an egg on top. It is unforgettable. The egg is the magic touch to me with this dish. They tend to have this more on the breakfast side but don't let that deter you. You can have them add the egg anytime. The richness of the warm yolk melding into this dish sends it over the top. Trust me you will absolutely love it. I give The Rokerji / Richardsons 5 stars in spite of some of the tired burned out staff members. Unfortunately some of the servers here have forgotten the True meaning of being in the service industry.  It is my feeling that the owner, Richardson, needs to remind his staff that there is 3 parts to a great dining experience. The ambiance, the fantastic food and the SERVER.  But for now overlook the occasional subpar server and give this place a try. It will become one of your favorite spots right after your first mouthwatering bite.

0VDsdFXpvtqhJ0mX3Vm8JA.text: Decided to stop here during a trip to Phoenix because they made the "Top 50 Restaurants in Arizona" list on one of their major magazines out there. (It's apparently a weird bar-restaurant sisterhood thing, but we tried the dishes mentioned in the mag, so we were definitely at the right place).  To start, we got the roasted garlic plate, which was massive. Could easily feed 2-3 people. The server explained the dish as he broke down the elephant garlic, then we got to feastin' on bread, cheese, peppers and, of course, garlic. Taste-wise, it lived up to the hype and was the favorite part of the meal for multiple people in our party.  We also got the house salad (basic, but good) and the Chimayo Chicken (stuffed with spinach, sun-dried tomatoes and cheese). Overall, really good, but the namesake GCP (Green Chile Potato) was disappointing and the carrots were underdone. I sampled the "gumbo" as well, which is nothing at all like a gumbo. It's basically jambalaya pasta.  The decor/ambiance is outstanding and the service is adequate. Would I say they're Top 50 in Arizona?
