Has really gone down (prices however have gone UP) I ordered the swordfish which came smothered in a spicy sauce of some kind...totally overpowered the flavor of the fish (or what SHOULD have been flavor of fish) Beets were kind of slimy but otherwise ok the brocollini was good. My friend had the chicken and was not overly impressed either...a bit dry and overpowering sauce again.

_49lB8VAXxpp5KT1VnvNrw.text: I visited the Rokerij a few months back and it was pretty good. The hype of the place didn't really live up to expectations, but maybe it was just because we were in a back room..   We had a private back room. The server forgot to put in a couple orders, one of the girls ended up getting her food after all of us were done. We did have some great mimosas, and our plate was good. I might try this again someday. Maybe on a date or something. The lights were really low and romantic. I personally like it a little brighter so we can see the people around us, but I get the purpose of the dim effect. This place would be nice if you're looking for a fancy dinner with a date.

wbJ-zi0qhXmwSBlix3TVbA.text: We held a private event in the back room of the Rokerji.  The party was 19 people and the service was flawless.  Not the mention, the food was delicious and everyone was blown away.  If you haven't tried the Pasta Heidi, you must!  Secret - sub the chicken for shrimp.  It's worth it..

8QS7uLpCKkCwAGRTvGt0rg.text: Dined here Saturday night with another couple and we were all impressed. Great service, cool atmosphere, and awesome food. Started in the basement bar which reminded us of what a speak easy would have been like then upstairs for apps and dinner. We are adding this to our favorite date spots.

oUAn8CphUYdIKrv8UJCCKA.text: This restaurant is amazing. Tonight I had the prime rib with brussel sprouts and the carbonara pasta. It was amazing! Everything was top notch. I loved it and absolutely will be back. Also the wine selection is truly good as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Prickly Pear Margarita

Jyijnpll2lZl_0s6GTP2Jw.text: We needed to have a last minute business meeting with a client and our office is in the middle of a remodel so I called the Rokerij. Athough the private room was already reserved for the evening, they were able to accomodate us for a few hours prior to then we moved to the main restaraunt for dinner.  Everything was perfect especially the service and  of course the food!

VF9DUb2XchKBLo-6i6sJfA.text: Very disappointing.  I was really looking forward to a clubby bar with great appetizers and conversation.  I arrived first, valet parked, walked downstairs to the bar, turned around walked back out and told my friend to meet me at Richardson's instead.  Downstairs was too small.  Too dark.  Too warm with the fireplace going.  Bar was packed and the chairs and couch I tried weren't comfortable.  I also checked out the upstairs bar which was too exposed to the kitchen and garbage.

T8t8IIh6sHjHdv9ztSsUyw.text: Great atmosphere. We managed to arrive during a raging rain storm which limited some seating but the staff was more than accommodating. Happy hour menu was good as was the service. We will be back.

12Fl4D4-NNO_k-Q9DIL1dA.text: Pretty good food and atmosphere.  Went there today just after 2:00 with my wife for lunch.  But the valet didn't seem to care for where I wanted to park my motorcycle.  Fine, but don't try to have me park it RIGHT in front of the main entrance where the yellow lines indicate it's a pedestrian walkway!  I don't need people messing with my bike as they walk into the establishment.  Or some unwary customer burning a leg on the hot pipes.  I like this restaurant, but I didn't feel welcome at all today.  It's mid-afternoon for Christ's sake!

AlZkiGxiVrmA5XoVjkcExw.text: Was an awful experience.  I ask at the beginning if I could have a separate tab.  Never happened.  My daughter got prime rib sliders, spit out the first bite and that was that.  I had the chicken schnitzel.  Horrible.  Service non existent

VIo4htKRM5y0Vud5csspYQ.text: I loved the trout. Atmosphere is really dim and chill. I enjoy myself there. Bartender and chefs are super cool. Service always great they take good care of us. All around an awesome place.

ABbP0PDMYoMdNRowFUo0eA.text: Where to begin?  Food is incredible.  Service is superb.   Atmosphere is welcoming and dark, but with a fireplace.  Open kitchen.  Smells wonderful.  Mike and AJ at the bar are great.  Laura and Dave at the grill and cooktop are masters.  We went twice in 3 days after moving close and we'll be back countless times!

6Kr8cYcmGXYw0Jw34kY7cA.text: I rarely leave any comments, but this one is deserved.  The hostess was cold and uninviting, the waitress was incredibly absent minded, and the entire staff we engaged with seemed like they were recovering from a hangover.  The food - this is the third time we've had brunch, and we've given it this many tries because we've had great dinners in the grotto downstairs, but it's like 2 different restaurants.  Our scrambled eggs were the best part of the meal.  We both had french toast that was covered with raw eggs that made the toast just fall apart.  Mine didn't come with butter or syrup, so we had to request it.  We both took 1-2 bites before giving up, and the pork loin was tuff with no flavor.  My second cup of coffee came with about half-full because they "ran out of coffee and had to go next door".  It came with about a full teaspoon of coffee grounds in the bottom of my cup, and I had no water to get the grit out of my teeth since non of us were given water at the table.  Our total bill for the two of us was about $40, and I've had much better meals at Denny's.

rAFECHZ-IB4ZP8tJkeJ7pg.text: I've been going here for nearly 10 years, I love the Rokerij. The cellar is the best bar in Phoenix if we're talking about ambiance alone.   I would have given 5 stars if it weren't for Steve no longer working here. I haven't been in since I found out he left, he was a big reason why I loved coming here.

HPrrKomsKQlvj6klG0OQ0g.text: What an amazing place! Great wine selection, delicious appetizers, great music, no cell phone reception. The place is perfect, even if you can't pronounce the name!

pVTxf9BG65WMUnODDbW2lA.text: I was visiting Phoenix and we came here for my brother's birthday. We had heard great things about the restaurant, so we were really looking forward to trying this place! We had a very unsatisfactory experience to say the least. While the drinks, appetizers, and main course meals were GREAT, the service was awful. Our waiter was spacey and not helpful at all. We even had to ask to speak to the manager because of how bad the service was. The manager apologized and took care of us; however, I don't think I would come back to this restaurant due to the service experience.

LnQf7KJ9j0uF-lNZauZhtQ.text: I absolutely love this place!  It had been years since I had been back and when we had a friend in town from DC we decided to take him here...great beer & wine list, amazing food, some of the best atmosphere in town and great service.  I started with a wedge salad and then enjoyed the chimayo chicken for my entree...the perfect meal!  After dinner we went downstairs to the bar and continued our fun evening.  This place is perfect to escape a hot summer day or to warm up on a cold winter night.  If you haven't been, you are surely missing out!

D64bO92o67HWDN6n-iBP9Q.text: Beyond 5 stars always on amazing food & service! Whenever I am in Phoenix, this is a must stop for dinner or brunch! Never disappoints!

ITG9yxIa412EXrG8OOmkag.text: Probably the best dinner I've ever had to date. Had the Mahi Mahi with pineapple salsa, roasted beets and twice baked potatoe in a pepper! Very good. Everyone in my party enjoyed their meals.  The service was great, and they even brought us a trio dessert for our anniversary. Would highly recommend.  They were busy, I would recommend reservations.

yLlV5FFFNxlfFN5eEq9vGQ.text: If I were to choose a place to go on a romantic date in Phoenix, Rokerij would be at the top.  It also would be near the top of my list for places to bring a friend visiting Phoenix.  Honestly, Rokerij is near the top of all my lists.  Your experience begins when you head down a flight of stairs into what appears to be a small rock-walled cavern.  There are cozy chairs next to a fireplace if you want to chill with friends, romantic booths hidden away in niches (definitely reserve these in advance if you want one!) and spots at a bar where we witnessed bar staff chatting about patrons casually about life and doing everything that a bartenders do in classy places that they don't in, you know, Scottsdale.  The food is spectacular.  I tried the carne adovada and liked it, but Phoenix is full of good authentic Mexican food.  The star here for me was really the Seared Pecan Trout, which apparently is local from Arizona and wild-caught.  The fish is melt-in-your-mouth buttery with absolutely incredible flavor.  Pair it with the brussel sprouts and a glass of wine for a wonderful (and actually healthy!) meal.  We lucked out and caught a "half off bottles of wine" happy hour, but it looks like there's a good selection of cocktails on the menu as well.  10/10 would come again.

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pecan seared trout!

SMgBrbXmZ9tjrhHWnPQK-g.text: A must try if you are from the area or just visiting. Some people did not like the valet parking- however we went on a Friday night and wouldn't have been able to find a spot without it!  We tried to make a reservation but were told that they accept walk ins and we went at 5:30. They were able to accommodate us and when we walked through- it was clear it's a very small place with mostly large tables. Looked fun for a group!   They had great happy hour menu- most of the starters were discounted. We had the stuffed jalapenos and calamari. The best part of the night was the surf and turf - filet, bacon wrapped shrimp and two enchiladas!   Check out the bar downstairs as well - so cozy and inviting. The staircase on the way down made it feel like we were going to a dungeon in a castle- great architecture! It is connected to Richardsons so stopping there for a drink is a great idea as well.

PiAuFeFs4JQhob9ZWDacrg.text: This is the best place hands down to get your hands on some New Mexican cuisine in the Phoenix metropolitan area. Try the carne adovada or tomahawk! And don't get me started on the drinks. Sean, Seth, and Brooke are some of the best bartenders in this area. Try an espresso martini or horchata martini, you won't regret it!! And PJ has some fantastic harmonica skills!

JdjPKvE_8do_oYc9xAqGUw.text: This place is rockin' on so many levels. My group decided to go downstairs, and I am so glad we did. The dungeon-like entrance so reminded me of some great European restaurants that I've been to in the same vein.  Once downstairs, our party of four sat at the bar corner so we could talk to one another, and because all the tables were reserved. If you want a table downstairs even on a Sunday night, I would suggest that you call for reservations! The bar, however, was a great experience.  Nicole, our server, was knowledgeable and sweet. She recommended the trout that one member of my party had that was soooo good.  They don't skimp on the food either. My plate was brimming over with food, and Nicole kindly boxed up what I couldn't eat.  With half price (starred on the menu) bottles of wine night, we opened a bottle of red cab that easily slid down our throats.   Great food, great server, great experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Carne Adovada
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Dinner menu
Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Going downstairs!

4vPeuanD2aIlrP4vdKqRjg.text: Cozy and dim little restaurant with fireplaces and wine bottle storage all around you. They have very tasty happy hour bites that pair so nicely with the drinks they offer. Bacon wrapped scallops? Yes please. Carne avodava sliders? Hell yeah. Add a glass of red and you've got the perfect date.   I've been here several times for brunch because it's great food and there is NO wait on the weekends.   Their Huevos Rancheros con chorizo are knock-it-out-of-the-park delicious. And so much food that I was able to keep about half of it for breakfast the next day. All those delicious, yet understated, flavors all compliment each other so well. I was graced with a sample of their french toast, and it is pretty amaze also.   Last time I was here, I tried the salmon benedict and was underwhelmed. It needed some sort of kick or maybe a heavy glaze on the salmon because the flavor combos were pretty bland. Since they don't have any hot sauces aside from sriracha, I was outta luck on that front.   On a more positive note, you know it's gonna be a good mimosa when they ask "Do you want a little bit of orange juice, or a lot orange juice?" Honey, the mo' champs the better. She nods and says "I thought so!" Wine glass sized mimosas = yes.   See you next time, Rokerij.

wW9L0P5Mb8ihosr6m2UBzQ.text: So I have the most complicated time trying to pronounce this! However, once you get into the "dungeon" you can quickly realize how the I and J turn into a Y on the plate. I got the Chilean Sea Bass and it. Was. AMAZING! Had a couple of appetizers and they were also delish. I think one was a cheese bread, a meat and cheese bread, and a cheese dip. Everything was delish. The atmosphere was amazing and so intimate. I was there for a work gathering but the it seems perfect for a little date night. I would definitely go again.

iRAbPoceZ4Q6ldlvV1KLjA.text: Read the reviews and drove an hour to check this place out and all i can say is Wow the food was super BLAND! We ordered the Scallops they were Rubbery, Schraders Sausage tasted ok at best, the "famous" meat skewers that were extremely Dry. Not impressed!

PDtTEcBPUAMAOL5JqqfHPg.text: AWESOME. I took my wife for a celebration and this place did not disappoint. We randomly showed up around 4 and were able to get a table in the cellar as it was about 2 hours until that dinner reservation.  I ordered the Rokerij steak which is a bacon wrapped filet with king crab on top and it was life changing. It was so mouth wateringly good. My wife had the chilean  seabass which was also fantastic.  And for dessert we topped it off with a cheesecake which was whipped in a little cup. great stuff and i definitely will be back to try the prime rib.  PS. you don't need cash for the valet, they have an app where you can digitally tip! Awesome

Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. rokerij steak

R9GGd2Juya7vM1J_8Nzh2A.text: Got turned on to this Hidden Gem a few years ago and now every time I go to Scottsdale this is a must stop. Few vacation destinations or anything close to where you live will come close to the quality and caliber of this food. The menu is southwest hevan-amazing, the ambience, atmosphere, and vibe are super cool and unique. Even if you don't have time for lunch brunch or dinner do yourself a favor and at least go underground into the bar set in a Scottish Pub ( I understand they imported it and reconstructed the pub underground with the original Tavern stones). Absolutely absolutely add this place to your AZ bucket list.

IGtUpb79SKps0zdyfSSQDg.text: My boyfriend and I came here for the first time tonight and oh my goodness...this place is fantastic. There was a bit of a wait so we went downstairs to enjoy some drinks and an appetizer. The chipotle ribs were AMAZING. Literally fell off the bone. We eventually went upstairs and had Holly as our server. She was sweet and helped us throughout the menu. Seriously, one of my favorite places ever. We will definitely be back! Ps. The tortillas here are out of this world.

xQxI5U-3sOB1E_rLZgSd7g.text: Place has gone waaaaaaay down hill. Just left with a group of friends of mine and here's two more reasons why I won't be returning and neither will my friends...  2 friends ordered the 'midwesterner' on the description it says it includes bacon. Bacon never came on the meal. The server insisted it did not come with bacon even though we showed him the menu to prove it did. After 10 minutes we finally got bacon.  Now it's times to leave and there's 8 of us and we request only 3 checks. We were told "we can't do separate checks." Mind you this was never informed of us on the menu or by our server. I said you can't or you won't? My server said "we don't, sorry" so for the next few minutes we had to individually write on the check the amount we wanted out on each card.  I even separated the checks for him to show him what items to put on what cards. He said he couldn't do that because he needed an amount. ARE YOU KIDDING ME?!? I've seen and worked with their system. It's easy as pie to separate checks. Especially with only 3 tabs.   Don't come back to this place. It was hot in 2003 when it first opened. Or maybe it was a few years later when it "accidentally" caught fire. Ya know, just like his other 2 restaurants. Must be a coincidence though

5XnPoG_yscndoCOIA9Qxrg.text: What a nightmare experience! This was my first time coming here and will definitely be my last.   Here for a small birthday party of 5. We got there pretty early at 6:15 and now just leaving freakin dinner at 9:15. 3 hours?!? This wasn't a 20 course meal.  Service was horrible. I mean absolutely horrible. Our waiter had no personal skills, ignored our table pretty much throughout the dinner and didnt even check on us ever. I 100% understand when a kitchen is backed up or its busy in the restaurant. Just let us know instead of ignoring us and deliberately walking fast past our table.   They pride themselves on being a steakhouse and the prices are certainly on par with mastro's and steak 44 but place fell way short. Now I was the only one with a bad meal - I ordered the filet but asked for it plain and no bacon wrap. Of course, it came out with bacon on it. Fine, whatever, i'll just take it off.  The entire thing tasted like bacon and not steak. I know i'm the only person who doesnt like bacon in the world but turned the steak into plain piece of crap. Meat was tough.   Bad service and bad food = not getting my money again.

WDew2lieNIBFr3cl8U4vyQ.text: We came in for a birthday dinner with a group of 10.  Upon arriving, 4 of us where a bit early and were seated.  The waitress took our drink order's immediately and offered us the happy hour menu as it was about to end in 30 minutes.  We ordered the bacon wrapped jalapenos, calamari with chili sauce to start with.  When our drinks were brought out, I must say, they were very good.  If you love strong drinks, this is the place to have them.  Once our calamari arrived, it had a lot of sauce poured on them.  I picked at the calamari that had no sauce and it was cooked perfectly.  Less sauce would make this dish better.  The bacon wrapped jalapenos were good.  Just the right amount of kick.  Once everyone arrived, we ordered dinner.  I had the Prime NY with asparagus and the baked potato.  When my plate arrived it all looked great.  The potato was perfectly cooked and the asparagus was not over cooked.  My steak on the other hand was disappointing.  I could taste the freezer burn, I asked for  medium steak and it was almost well done, it was not tender at all.  You could see the lines in the steak where it had freezer burn.  The table I was sitting at send 3 dishes back and I felt bad sending mine back as well.  Every plate that was sent back was either under cooked or overcooked and one was the wrong plate.  The place was busy with several parties.  Drinks took a while to be served after the 2nd round.  Overall, its ok.  I would come back for drinks and appetizers, not the food.

rvdflzxp8NFDMnu7_DNSng.text: Our meal was 5 stars until the very end.  A little back story. I made reservations for our group of 4 for 8:30 pm. We arrived a few minutes before 8:30 and after being given the run around about table options we finally decided to sit at the bar. We were not even very concerned about waiting a bit about the table, but obviously the hostess felt bad and offered to comp our first round of drinks. That was nice of her - we thought!  We all thoroughly enjoyed our meals and had plans of bringing out of town visitors back as soon as got the opportunity. The problem came when the bill arrived and they forgot to comp our drinks. We decided to say something to the bartender who passed it off to the very rude manager on duty.   The manager proceeded to make us feel as though we made up the fact that the hostess offered to comp our drinks explaining that "she shouldn't have offered that and we usually don't do that". We then told him that really wasn't our problem, but his hostess offered it and we expected it to be honored. He then rudely walked off trying to locate the nowhere to be seen hostess, even trying to call her. He came back to the POS station located right by our bar seats and said "this is BS" while hastily punching into the POS system. All the while making us feel very awkward. He did not handle that situation correctly at all and sadly left a bad taste in all of our mouths that not even that delicious tasting meal could salvage.

sE2MpA8pyIEwnJC9EhIrsA.text: Awesome happy hour! The bacon wrapped jalapenos are out of this world. Good service. Nice ambience

_rjq9Eq3_W5sxw7yPgI83w.text: The food here is beyond amazing and not to mention the amazing staff goes above and beyond to give excellent customer service. I highly recommend brunch and a Bloody Mary

huw0zLpmcIJ1vrr4qyq2zg.text: I've heard great things about Richardson's, Rokerij, and Dick's Hideaway. I've dined at Rokerij twice and was very underwhelmed by both experiences. Most recently, I called ahead to make a reservation at Richardson's to give this group of restaurants another shot. When we arrived, the hostess said the person who made our reservations "messed up" and was supposed to call me back to notify me they were moving our reservation to Rokerij rather than Richardson's due to a table mix up. We were never called. She assured us the menu was almost identical, so I didn't make a big deal about it. We got the calamari, which was all right. It came with a sweet chili sauce that tasted like sweet and sour sauce you get with spring rolls at a Chinese restaurant. I ordered one of the specials: trout with cilantro-lemon pesto. It came with a house salad, mashed potatoes, and I got asparagus as the veggie. The salad tasted fine, but definitely did not seem like great quality. The server said the salad came with some sort of jalapeno creamy dressing, but it tasted like bottled Ranch dressing. It reminded me of a salad bar salad. The trout was also nothing special. The cilantro-lemon pesto was not lemony at all. The mashed potatoes were very good. That and the wine are the only reasons I'm giving them 2 stars. The New Mexican enchiladas with green sauce was VERY spicy. The server did not forewarn us. The server also forgot to bring 1 salad and never brought me silverware. For the price we paid, I expected more attention to detail and better quality food.

NovUD-OfVJdcZRxfP58kJQ.text: Hands down the worst service I have ever received!!! For the cost they need to step it up !!! Waited a hour and fifteen min to get food with empty glasses !

BiQRAi0MpCYXQyq9I3KBTA.text: Food sucks had to wait way past our reservation time  not impressed. Waitress tried but failed

jhn42sKPr9ot8BODR9ryJg.text: I saw this place on Check Please Arizona and thought it looked amazing so I decided to give it a try.   Right off the bat I was turned off by the forced valet parking. I asked if I could park it myself and was told no. I was about to leave but still came all this way to try it out so I let them park my vehicle. It's not that I'm a cheapskate, I just don't like people driving my car, it's lowered and has expensive rims on it and valet has damaged my things before.  Ok so, the car was parked and we went to the downstairs bar. I really love the look of this place, the bar was dark and really cool. I asked if they had a happy hour menu and the bar tender said "not really" and handed us a menu for food then told us the beer was $2 off, well drinks $6 and some wines were on special. I asked for my usual vodka martini and it was a generous pour but was a bit pricey at $9 even though I was told it was "6 and a half, or 7 and a half". Not sure why it's a mystery as to the pricing of drinks, it's a bar after all.  The menu for happy hour food was quite extensive but the prices were a bit steep. I decided to try the chipotle ribs for $9 and my woman went with the brie toast for $10.  The ribs were small and kind of tasteless really. They had a bit of spice and the meat was tender but they lacked flavor. The rice was wet and nothing to write home about and the little tortilla did nothing for me. Overall a very bland dish and pricey for the 5 little ribs that came. I compare this to something like the ribs and fries dish at White Chocolate Grill for $10 which has a half rack of delicious ribs and a generous portion of amazing fries. I go back to WCG for that. I would not go back here for this.  The toast with brie was sad. Tiny pieces of bread with a smear of brie for $10? Nothing to dip into? Garbage. You should be ashamed to serve that dish for the price you charge.  Also, downstairs had no wifi and there is no way to get any signal from a phone.   The bartender was ok but he left his duty to spend 15 minutes writing specials on the chalk board and left his patrons sitting there with empty drinks and empty plates. We might have ordered another drink but didn't have the opportunity to so we just left.  What a shame. I like the idea and look of the place but they fail on the food I tried and to have valet only screams pretentious LA wannabe restaurant.

Tkfj4HU78wl55tt70-6euA.text: I've been to Rok a lot throughout the years. I love this spot. It is super romantic if you are on a hot date, but it is also a great spot to belly up at the bar when eating alone.   The food and service are always amazing. Some of my favorites are the adovada, the Danish pancake, and the French toast for breakfast. For lunch the BBQ chicken pizza is always on point. The dinners are fabulous for the carnivores, the steaks and chops are simply divine.   I recently went for a big group of 15+ ladies and we reserved the back room. It was so much fun to have the spot all to ourselves and when the door as shut you couldn't hear our boisterous voices booming through the rest of the restaurant.   If you haven't been, try the Rok asap.

k2KXD-9R8qRr0ZQoDb2v_w.text: Been here several times for lunch, happy hour & dinner. New Mexico Enchiladas are my fave, with extra red chile sauce. This was our first time for brunch. The Richardson's Combo (jalapeno benedict smothered w/jalapeno hollandaise, 2 chicken enchiladas/choice of red/green chile, & asparagus. I substituted the the English muffin for shredded hash browns. Highly recommend!

EDHOmBp4xnfV0cTiYLauVA.text: There is no doubt the food is excellent at this restaurant. We went for a total of four times. The last visit was a couple of years ago and it was for our son's birthday celebration.  For my appetizer, I ordered fresh raw oysters and they tasted wrong. Smelly not fresh for baby oysters.  I mentioned this situation to the waiter and took the oysters and returned them to the kitchen and came back to our table and said he could do nothing about the inedible raw oysters. There had been no other complaints. Period. He did not remove the cost from our check. We never went back. That night we spent hundreds of dollars and had such poor customer service that none of us will return.

2JvFC2WcBVizpB5OVdbFBQ.text: The Rokerji is amazing- food, drinks, people (always seem to meet someone(s) new & interesting, and the atmosphere- enjoyed the basement and fireplace this past Saturday while it was raining.  The food was fantastic and the wine was delicious (of course). The service has declined a bit over the past couple years.  At times the servers and/or bartenders are too rushed and can be slightly rude at times. If not for that Rokerji would definitely get 5stars from me.

D10jAbvt3Xw8o7Nva0ep2w.text: Cane here for an early date night with the honey loves. It was the first one we have had in a few weeks since we both have been busy. Saw this place on yelp pretty good review so decided to check this place out. Everything here is so dim which I don't mind as it's a cute date night set up. We were sat down quite quickly. However after the waiter sat us down he didn't come back until after 15 mins to ask for drinks. Bf and I asked for water. Water took another 15 minutes. Place was pretty empty. We saw him chit chatting. After food came out. Everything looked so yummy so decided to forget about long wait. Had the ceasar salad which was yummy. Next was the entree. SALTY! Side dish. SALTY. Bfs entree SALTY. Bfs side dish okay. I decided to be full after taking a bite of nothing but saltiness. Definitely will not be coming back. As I'm writing this I still taste the salt in my mouth. Lol it's been weeks.

A1nrC6Gl0x2HrnEU0c7Gvg.text: For lunch it's very limited on meats, the bbq  brisket sandwich was not a sandwich, but a freaking burger! That's misleading! If I wanted a brisket burger, I'll go to a burger specialty place

Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States. If you order the bbq brisket sandwich beware it will come with a bun and look like a burger!!

S4nfa3savVQS2vvlcRZc3Q.text: One of the best steakhouses in the Southwest! I brought my wife here for what we call "a fancy dinner date". We saw Rokerij featured on PBS' "Check Please, AZ" and it seemed like the perfect place for a romantic dinner - we were not disappointed.  Rokerij is a Dutch smokehouse with a New Mexican menu - they are most famous for their carne adovada and their steaks (the tomahawk steak is insane).  The building itself is beautiful rustic cottage, and the interior is equally appealing with a very intimate and classy feel. There is also a downstairs "cellar" with a second bar and additional dining; that space is limited and fills up too quick but it's worth it if you can get a booth down there. The atmosphere is genuine, this restaurant is legit. Also a nice touch, are the unique metal plates the food is served on - gives an old European feel to the meal.  Aside from a hostess who acted like we just woke her from a slumber and actually asked us "how may I help you?"... ummm we are here to dine? That elicited a look of confusion, not sure why lol. Aside from that annoying hiccup, our server was fantastic - she was attentive and fast and gave honest recommendations to make sure we ordered something that would be to our satisfaction.  We started with the carne adovada sliders, which were incredibly moist, tender, and flavourful. We gobbled them up pretty quick and they were rather filling.  My wife ordered the Rokerij Steak, which is a surf n turf - filet mignon and crab, and I ordered the prime rib. Both our dishes were amongst the best we've ever had, I'll just leave it at that. My wife complimented the quality of the meat and adored the sauced. My prime rib was gigantic and cooked to perfection - there was nice crispy sear on the outside, with seasonings, and nice & pink on the inside. As far as prime ribs go, it was a masterpiece!   Needless to say, we dropped around $!60 for a dinner for two, but this is a once-a-year type dinner for us and I look forward to being able to go back one day. As far as smokehouses go, and especially dutch-style smokehouses, Rokerij is one of the finest restaurants around.

2JBlOgfgBmf5WoywELJV4g.text: Fantastic restaurant with wonderful food, excellent staff, and extensive wine list. Portions are huge, even the appetizers!

1HgIOTyzQZUnO7uFhBOYRg.text: I believe this service tonight was one of the worse ever! To start  a 6:00 reservation .  Over two hour to get dinner . Inedible pork! Delivery of 4 meals not at same time .  Appetizer served but then again signature dish burnt to a crisp .   Asked would you like another glass of wine to be asked again and again before getting it .  Obvious neglect by waiter  . Salads appearing really so late and with brown lettuce .  Wow what has happened ? been here many times before and was marvelous .  No one seemed to care they blamed each other ?!?  Sorry this restaurant does no longer rank as the best . It wasn't even busy .  A Tuesday night .  Sadly I will think more than twice about returning .   Wow it's so sad !

0QQX7BMIITZrSY3eXP7d-g.text: Let me start off by saying that I love Richardson's and have been eating there for 25 years. That being said their sister restaurant Rokerij was an absolute train wreck! So much so it's almost hard to believe what you are about to read. Lets start off with the reservation, it took some kid 15 minutes to take my name and make a reservation. So bad it was someone had to finally take the phone from him to finish a 17 minute reservation. On to the next day. Many restaurants will call the day before to confirm your reservation and it's almost always done during the day. Not them they called my house at 9:30 at night and woke everyone up. I said to the kid who called what the hell are you doing? His reply: my job! At this point I should have seen the writing on the wall and cancelled the reservation for the next day. But we didn't! So on to Saturday night dinner. First off the place is loud, real loud I'm good with it but it's not Romantic intimate dining like they post on their site. So the first thing I did was ask to speak to a manager to tell him what took place the prior 2 days. I found him to be very aloof and had his mind on 10 other things. On to dinner my wife and I order an ice tea and a glass of wine for her. The tea came in 5 min. The wine took 15 min. So slow we had a busboy bring it finally . We ordered an appetizer of bacon wrapped shrimp and we waited over 20 min. During this time we placed our dinner orders. In 30 seconds after we ordered dinner they bring me my salad. I said where's the appetizer please take the salad back. The waitress comes back to the table and says it should be coming right up. And then she brings us bacon wrapped jalapeno poppers! I said we didn't order these she looks confused? I said bacon wrapped shrimp her reply is not I'm very sorry it's you realize all your food is going to come out together. I said no! Slow the dinner down and please speed up the correct appetizer. So after 25 minutes we got the appetizer and it was good as always. The server then said this is on the house and I said thank you. Dinner: I had the chicken schnitzel with a baked potato. The schnitzel was dry and had no seasoning in it all all. The sauce was suppose to be a butter sauce with capers. It was running butter water with no flavor and onion and capers in the bottom you couldn't get to.The baked potato was not fully cooked and very firm. My wife had salmon sliders she said were well done but she doesn't like to complain. She ate 1 of 3 On to the check. The waitress is no where to be seen so the busboy brings the check On the check is a 19 dollar charge for the shrimp they were paying for Plus a 10 dollar charge for the Jalapeno poppers we didn't order And a 7 dollar charge for a house salad that was suppose to be included with the meal. Because the server wasn't around I vented to the busboy again and he got them taken off the bill Then the manager shows up and says how was you dinner. I said seriously? You don't know what went on? He said no. I said that explains why things were not done correctly on the bill. He was clueless. I eat out a lot and love writing good reviews. In fact this is only the second bad review I have ever written . When the reservation part is a disaster And the confirmation is a disaster and the service is a disaster and your dinner is no good all I can think is bad management?  And one last thing when I spoke to the manager for the second time after the dinner his excuse was a big table had sent back and several people changed there meal orders? I didn't realize that trickle down affect would be so severe lol Give me a break. I'm so upset because again we love Richardson's and think since the menus have a lot common dishes the food would be great Unfortunately nothing further from the truth

Pw78lZ2j4lW6BgJaI_RZHQ.text: I just got back from Rokerij.  My husband and I went there for Happy Hour last night and sat at the bar downstairs and had a nice time. We checked it out because my girlfriends and I were having dinner there tonight and had made reservations for 3 people at 4:00 pm.  We get together every other month at a restaurant and spend quite a bit of time catching up.  However, we are always EXTREMELY generous with a tip to make up for the time we take at the table. Today, we arrived at Rokerji and were immediately seated downstairs....great!  We all had two glasses of wine and full dinners.  We had our money together (which included a 25% tip)and were enjoying our second glass of wine when the waiter asked if we could vacate the table (it was barely 6:30) as they had another reservation waiting.  I asked if we could go sit at one of the other two tables that had been sitting empty ever since we had arrived at 4:00 and they said no, they were reserved!!!  They said we could go upstairs and sit at the bar there, so we thought no big deal.  Then we went upstairs to a totally packed bar.  I eat out at restaurants OFTEN and have never basically been told give me your money and get the hell out; especially after only 21/2 hours!!!!  One of the waiters upstairs said that their reservations are only good for a 2 hour seating.  This did not appear on their website or open table; if it had, I would not have reserved.    The food was EXCELLENT, but I will never go there again.  We did not penalize our waiter for the rudeness of the owners, but I can assure you, we will share this experience for years to come.  Mary M.

5tZjHbXbkT9HDel_DsVw2w.text: Disappointed, the Rokerij was closed so they're trying to squeeze everyone in on the Richardson's side. The service was bad. Can't blame the servers, they are short of help.  Sitting was bad and food was very slow to come out.  It's a shame.  Use to be be a fun place. And loved the food on the Rokerij side

6HsthNN3cPIFjVPSQdfXlQ.text: Loved the ambiance. Food was excellent. Good sized portions. Both of the Ashley's spelled 2 different ways, that served us were great and very helpful. Definitely going back. Our out of town guests were really impressed. Thanks for the great night

PFPKT89oAUu6qbEcSRUGWw.text: Nice intimate place, cozy comfort food, get the garlic plate wow. Fresh delicious seafood, healthy, tasty and decent portions. Pricey but worth it.

v0kUYHKclSvO8sqocGBiJA.text: Great ambiance and service.  Rokerij has an innovative menu with something for everyone. I especially like their house salad, which isn't on the menu but comes with most entrees. The only negative is that they still put too much salt in their food, particularly the sauces. I've started asking for it on the side.

GIeTq1xr3HXTZiNSey364Q.text: What a disappointment.  Wife and I arrived at 10:30pm on Saturday and requested a fireside table.  (We have eaten here before but always at the bar where the service and food is good.)  Hostess was very pleasant, took us to the table, poured some water and left. Restaurant was pretty empty.  For the next 15 minutes we tried to signal the lone waiter and the bus person without success. Went back to find hostess but nobody there. Took another couple of minutes to attract the attention of a bartender at the bar to tell him we were leaving. Then we left.  Rokerij advertises it is open till midnight. My impression is they had mentally closed at 10:30pm.

c_IGYM2XHKE1pE3eO48lCQ.text: The meal I enjoyed was outstanding.  The steak was cooked just how I asked (no pink, yet still tender & juicy) & was covered with an amazing semi-sweet & smoked sauce. It was plated on what I think were mashed sweet potatoes !!!  Now that being said the enchiladas plate we ordered was extremely burnt & covered over with sauce (though still tasty once you dug in ) it was a disappointment and should have never been served. Lastly the young lady that took care of us kindly removed enchiladas plate from our bill (which we appreciated ). Since she did an outstanding job & tried to make the experience better, we tipped her 20% plus the cost of the enchiladas plate ( it was Christmas & it wasn't her fault that is was bunt & covered in sauce right?)  I would've given them 5 stars... it was a minor mistake & I'm sure they are usually on point but still.  We'll try them again this weekend on our way driving back from NM to Palm Springs hopefully it's a fluke and not a trend.  #staytuned

cUB3OpCW-aV3_nM-mST3fg.text: Food 5 stars / Service 3 stars (Read Below)  Rokerij is part of the Richardson's/ Dicks Hideaway Family  - I've loved and been too both Richardsons and Dicks hideaway several times and always excited for my next visit.  Rokerij is located right off 16th street - reminder additional parking around back.  The restaurant appears to be an old brick home updated and converted super cute. Upon walking inside immediately in front of you is the bar to left and seating to right with huge fire place.  The restaurant decor reminds me of a dark cigar type with dark colors and low lighting.    Today brought me with for Happy Hour with a party of over 20 Ladies - celebrating Ladies empowerment and leadership. It was a brief Happy Hour - today I ordered one of my favorite Wines - La Crema Chardonnay it's not an expensive wine but oddly so refreshing and one of my favorites.    From the Menu - Ordered the Chipotle Ribs that were absolutely amazing - the meat literally feel off the bone the spices and seasoning was perfect.    Service - Now here comes the tricky part, today was a large group - so upon seating I asked the server if we were able to split checks individually she politely said sadly I'm only able to do checks by table.  Immediately I knew issues would arise, as no one carries cash anymore.  At my table we were able to figure out check in a timely manner using cards and cash - but saw other tables were struggling and the poor server was trying to stay as positive as she could.  While I'm not sure if this was a rule for that day - or a usual rule not to split checks.  But this manner usually does not benefit the server - immediately I felt bad for the server with a party over 20.  Now I didn't talk to the Manager - but someone mentioned they did, she was informed that they tried to accommodate us with extended Happy Hour pricing and tables. Myself nor my table was aware of extended Happy Hour pricing and thankful they had seating.  Because I love this place - this one time issue will not dictate my future visits. I think initial communication may have limited issues with Party and restaurant.

HyFc5XwEipx3oZojmnmVpA.text: Would love to give this place a 5 Star but the service is the worst I've ever experienced. We have been here quite a few times and the food is always fantastic (both Richardson's and Rokerij) but the service is beyond bad 95% of the time:(

Aehva6fhgitt6mViL7zzxQ.text: Second visit was just as good as the first and reminded us about the AMAZING basement atmosphere and a local vibe.   This visit we made reservations for a late dinner and sat upstairs. I love the bar where we sat and waited for the rest of our friends to arrive. It was a very busy place because it doubles as the front of the kitchen where you can watch all the activity first hand. Quite entertaining actually.   The Rokerij steak was a bit pricy.... but my taste buds weren't disappointed. My wife had a shrimp and HOME MADE pasta dish that was also delicious. Gata love home made pasta!  The only bummer was my green chili mashed potato's appeared to have been made a few days earlier and not very palatable... same as the first visit. AND since this is Hatch Chili season I was hoping to get a little heat, but no joy.  Don't be scared... hit this place up and ENJOY. It's worth a visit for the atmosphere alone!

FP4npTqDm6eBs5MwWm7YPA.text: This was the fourth time I dined at The Rokerij in Phoenix,  the first two times I had a $100 gift card which neatly paid for two people, the third time the VP of my company treated and tonight a friend bought me a birthday dinner, so I have yet to pay to dine here.  Regardless of where you are in the world, The Rokerij is unique and a treat.  First off, there are VERY few restaurants west of the Mississippi that have basements.  The Rokerij's is a great place to mingle with friends.  Upstairs is a dark and friendly atmosphere that is thick with pecan smoke from the kitchen.  It is a small place with limited seating.  And the lines to snag those seats is long 7 days a week.  People who dine at The Rokerij tend to linger for hours so don't expect a rapid turnover.  And reservations are only accepted for parties of 4 or more.  I have seriously had THE best steaks I have ever had in my life at The Rokerij.  They broil them right in front of the bar patrons and honestly there is probably only a handful of places in America where steaks are done to such perfection.  Perfection is not cheap, and no guest should reasonably expect to get out the door for less than $50 per person, but more likely $75 or more.  Is it worth it?  Yes!  Tonight, being my birthday, I chose what I had a taste for and that was a Crab Louie salad.  I read some reviews and they agreed that the Crab Louie at The Rojerij is the best in Phoenix.  Several said it was much too large for one person.  So we pre-agreed that we would split the salad and order a couple of "small plates", which are equivalent to appetizers, but a bit more exotic.  When I heard how big the Crab Louie was I expected to get mounds of lettuce with the usual toppings in modest quantity.  The opposite was True.  The amount of lettuce was about what you would expect in a small dinner salad at Denny's, but it was HEAPED with real crab, many of the pieces being very chunky, and a generous amount of tomatoes, cucumbers, hard-boiled egg and avocados.  It was served with a Louie dressing and a Roquefort dressing.  I have had a taste for an awesome Crab Louie for about 6 months and being my birthday I felt I finally deserved it.  This one was amazing.  Bear in mind it was $20, which is extremely expensive for a salad, but split two ways it was just right.  To accompany the salad we ordered two appetizers.  One, a smoked sausage with caramelized onion was the perfect complement to the salad.  The other, bacon wrapped shrimp, was insanely good.  The bacon was crispy and tasty and the shrimp was tender and perfect.  I had heard that The Rokerij is known for their Bloody Mary's and we both had one.  No disappointment.  They were tall, full and spicy.  They were served with a beer chaser of Sam Adams (?!?!?) all for $7.  No argument there.  The amount of food between splitting the salad and appetizers was perfect.  We both ate everything and were pleasantly full.  That is until the waitress mentioned the dessert menu, which included Creme Brulee.  This was a "must do" so we split it.  What can I say?  Sinfull?  Covered with very fresh berries, the caramel topping was torched to a smoky perfection.  I could eat one of these for breakfast every day of my life.  Needless to say the atmosphere at The Rokerij is unique and as far from a "chain restaurant" as you can get.   I have always found the service head and shoulders above nearly any restaurant I have ever been to.  From the warm greeting at the door, to the waitress, to the very engaged busser to the (I'm guessing manager on duty) who came over to our table just after the bill was paid to very warmly thank us and shake both of our hands.  The Rojerij is THE place in Phoenix to enjoy the best of the best in food, one of the best dining environments in the country, and be made to feel as if you are close as family as to those in charge.  Don't be turned off by having to wait an hour or more and then ending up sitting at the bar.  If you really need to get your food faster, may I suggest McDonalds or Burger King?  In the end you get what you deserve to get if you know what to expect.

Z2xDQPcxffJkyAKbbcFhjA.text: Great food. Rokerij steak was awesome!!! The tenderloin & Brie appetizer was equally wonderful! Will return next time in town.

K1peMGDTvZnzNH3QzWuxiw.text: This is the first place I had to write a second bad review for. Some aspects of this place like the decor and environment are so amazing too bad they can't get there stuff together.   I want to note that hostess KENDRA was extremely rude to us. She was disrespectful, didn't seem to care and should not be in the customer service industry.

g3HRtFAIHIUVReaVO7R5Bw.text: We came here two years ago for a special event and booked the private room. We had about 12 of us and it was great. We were there for hours and it was great. Nothing rushed and I thought that they were just giving us our space. However we came back for Mother's Day and I realized this is just how they are. Really slow and aloof. We were there at 9am and it was empty, only a few tables. But that didn't move things along. We had a two year old with us and this is not a kid friendly place. No high chair nor booster. So imagine sitting there way too long trying to entertain a two year old on your lap! Go here when you want an intimate meal and you have nothing else you need to or want to do.

oyCpW8u0Zu6npoPNguqMEw.text: Rokerij is my go to breakfast spot every time, I visit Phoenix. The atmosphere there fits everything on the menu, pure New Mexico.Try the Carne Adovada it will not disappoint, it's awesome!

ByNN960bRe_H20uN_qd7Qw.text: I lived in Scottsdale for a couple years but have been going to Richardson's for the last 10years after my Fiance introduced me to the place. Since then Richardson's was burned down and Roker now serves the menu items that I loved at Richardson's!   You visit, you need to get the regular salad to start which is so simple but so amazing. Next you need to get the Garlic platter which is an appetizer that I absolutely love (the cheeses, the peppers, the sauce, the roasted garlic and the toasted baguettes- AMAZING!) Whenever we are in town (we now live in California), I make it a point to go back and eat this platter at least once during the trip.   This place is Southern Mex food and there is not a restaurant that can compare. In fact the closest I have gotten to eating something as tasty is when we create our own replication of the platter which is good but not the original!   In addition, try the quesadillas, chicken dish, bacon wrapped scallops..... all so yummy!

photos.caption: Photo of Rokerij - Phoenix, AZ, United States

SyUym4agEbcqXZjDpzaivg.text: This review includes my first impression and after numerous visits it still stands as a solid sexy 5 star spot.  This place is sexy....from the moment you start the slow descent down the stone steps you start to feel sexy ( well i did ! )  Anticipation starts to lick at you,  and you get the feeling you are about to experience something memorable.    The lower level of Rokerij Does not disappoint.  Upon entering I began to feel wanton....  Dimly lit with only 3 circular booth style table's, nice copper topped bar & a sexy hearth flanked by chairs, wonderful framed artwork dripped from every wall, I knew I was in date night heaven.  The waiter came over immediately, and was attentive throughout Dinner . Solid wine list offering by the glass /2 glass pitcher or full bottle.(we had a New zealand red that was very good)  An eclectic menu to chose from ; I ordered the sausage plate which arrived piping hot  with four perfectly grilled spicy sausages layered atop pinto beans, and a tortilla.  This was  a more spicy meal than i  had anticipated, and such a generous portion,  that  i actually could not finish it and had to have it boxed up .( great box that they give you--it is like receiving a gift) My dinner companion had the skewers over rice and beans and he enjoyed it .  Every thing about the place was hot and sexy we did not feel rushed as lingering is allowed here .....we finished up the wine by the hearth .  Ambiance & great service = a fabulous night   Update;  Happy hour here rocks. I can never say enough great things about the Rokerij!!

GnWVSYhvVOZ8LSBKqMUKKg.text: I've adored the downstairs bar and fireplace here for years - and had always been happy with the food and service. Somehow, the place fell out of rotation and off my radar for years. Until last week - when I was invited to join a small group for reverse happy hour. $5 wine, draft, marg.  $5 small plates. And all well worth it!  Between the four of us, we ordered: 2 orders of prime rib sliders 1 order carne adovada sliders 2 order shrimp piri piri 2 orders smoked salmon 1 order grilled oysters 1 order rokerij oysters  And it was WAY too much! Lots of food went home with us.  The shrimp piri piri with toast points was amazing - will definitely be ordering it again. The carne adovada sliders were the highlight of the night. GREAT flavor! The prime rib sliders were okay - but as others have pointed out - quite skimpy. The salmon was tasty - but we would have been fine with one order instead of 2. Grilled oysters were OK. I got spoiled with grilled oysters in New Orleans - these didn't come close. Rokerij oysters were fantastic and will be ordered again, for sure.  Happily - there's lots on the menu we didn't get to. Which means a great excuse to go back. Soon, and most likely often.  For me, the best part is the 10pm to close happy hour - even on Sunday. Not too many people going out for food and drink at 10 on a Sunday - gives me a guarantee of a spot at the bar and stellar service.  WIN!

6v3r1l3t4bSJD2XoOGPIcg.text: Seriously this is about as cool of a vibe and as good of food as you will find at this price. Richardson's upstairs or Rokerij downstairs are both a blast! I love how many different seating styles there are, and the staff's enthusiasm is contagious. The food is remarkable - we went crazy and tried several of the $5 plates after 10pm. The spicy scallops are really hot (and spectacular) - see photos.
